Reviews.Title: “Junior Suite with Terrace”
Reviews.Author: elaine d
Reviews.Content: The long walk up the many floors is worth the stay in the junior suite. Our bags were carried up for us and probably would have been carried down if we asked. The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: jml66
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel is the location. This is in my favorite part of Rome, right next to the Piazza Navona. It is also fairly close to the Pantheon or Campo dei Fiori, and is not too long a walk to St. Peter's or the Forum. There is a taxi stand very close by, and the bus routes along the Corso Vittorio Emanuele are not far either. If you know where to look, there are some nice restaurants tucked into the winding streets nearby. Over all, this is a very good place to stay, and I would not mind staying here again. It rates well on helpful staff and location. It is kind of pricey, but by Roman standards, it is a good deal. I've stayed here twice, and once with a friend staying in a separate room in the same place. The street noise varies. Generally, lower rooms against the Via dei Coronari are louder. Rooms away from there or higher up are quieter. One problem is that the floors are not carpeted, so if you have noisy neighbors upstairs, you might get woken early by their clomping about. Some mornings this was not a problem, but other mornings it definitely was -- it all depends on who is above you. Staying here in April, we had trouble getting the temperature cool enough. The hotel's air system was not yet onto fully cool mode, so the best we could do was stop heat from coming out, though the room would eventually warm up over time. We could open the window to cool the room off, but that let in more street noise. We kind of managed, but other rooms on our trip were much easier to regulate temperature than here. The terrace room on the top is really wonderful, and is a little oasis of calm in a busy city. There is no elevator, and you need to go up at least 2 flights of stairs to get to your room. I don't mind this, but if you have trouble with stairs, be warned. The hotel's breakfast is fine, but not spectacular. The staff is uniformly friendly and helpful. They are helpful carrying your bags up those stairs or arranging transport. Speaking of which, their airport transportation offer is a great deal. It's about 10 euro more than a cab, but is a much nicer car (Mercedes or Audi), has very friendly drivers, and they even meet you at baggage claim holding a sign.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: ImmerWandern
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in Rome at this very unassuming yet superbly located hotel. Here is a quick summary: Good: 1. Central location - major sights easy walking distance away 2. Can arrange pick-up service from the airport - worth the money 3. Cabs and buses nearby 4. Friendly and helpful staff 5. Good breakfast 6. Fairly large, clean rooms 7. Many dining options in the area 8. Free Wi-Fi - reliable service The "not-so-good" comments are not to be considered deal-breakers but more of caveats: 1. Potentially difficult to find - use pick up service if flying into Rome 2. Via dei Coronari can be noisy on weekend nights 3. No elevator - pack light 4. No nearby Metro underground station - but did not really need it. They offered to arrange a pick-up service from Leonardo da Vinci-Fiumicino airport. It was an excellent service; our ride was a late-model E-series Mercedes (essentially a limousine given the narrow streets and mostly small cars in Rome) and the driver, Alessandro, spoke excellent English. He gave us a quick run-down of the monuments we were passing on the way to the hotel. All this for the price of a regular cab. It was a perfect, no-hassle start to the vacation and, if you are flying into Rome, I highly recommend you take advantage of this service. , It helped to have somebody take us to the Via dei Tre Archi as it is a small alley off the Via dei Coronari. Once we knew how to get there we had no problem finding our way back during the rest of our stay. I suggest packing light, trying to fit all your needs into carry-on sized luggage or perhaps backpacks as there is no elevator. You have to carry the luggage up the first flight of stairs to the office to check in. Then there is a fairly tight spiral staircase leading to the floors. We did not need assistance with our luggage but other reviewers mentioned how the staff had helped them with theirs. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is someone around 24/7, but not necessarily sitting at the reception desk especially late at night or early in the morning. They respond quickly to the table bell on the desk. As is common at small hotels in Europe you have to leave your keys at the desk when heading out, and there is always staff around to buzz you in at the main door upon your return. We stayed at #24, a double bedroom one floor up from the reception and breakfast areas. The rooms including the bathroom were quite large by European hotel standards especially given the type of building (i.e. not new construction). The beds were comfortable. The bathroom had a heated towel rack. The window of the main bedroom opened out onto Via dei Coronari. We spent most of the day out of the hotel so the view was not critical. It got a little noisy down on the street Saturday night - not entirely unexpected - but the other nights were quiet. Our was the lowest floor for the hotel rooms and it would probably be quieter on the higher floors. Perhaps the best feature of the hotel was its location. The Piazza Navona is almost at the front door. The Pantheon was a short hop from there. The Trevi Fountain, in turn, was not not much farther east from the Pantheon. South from the Pantheon was the Capitol Hill overlooking the Roman Forum and the Colosseum. Northwest of Residenza Canali, across the Tiber River, was the Vatican. The Spanish Steps are a comfortable stroll away. If you need motorized transportation there is a taxi stand nearby at the north end of Piazza Navona at the Piazza Tor Sanguigna. There are also several bus routes stopping at the same spot. Unfortunately the nearest Metro underground station is Spagna, at the Spanish Steps. The breakfast service was very good with cold cuts, cheese, bread, pastries, yoghurt, fresh fruit, cereal, pie, and freshly-brewed coffee; the staff will brew expresso or cappuccino per request. There are countless dining options in the area, from the restaurants lining Piazza Navona and the Pantheon to the numerous cafes, osteria, trattoria and ristorante scattered along both main roads and tiny side streets. Be sure to do your research ahead of time or ask the staff for recommendations prior to getting into town. On the other hand you could leave it to serendipity and drop in on any establishment that looks interesting and perhaps make your own pleasant discovery. Residenza Canali ai Coronari can only enhance your experience in Rome. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; perfect for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: bing52
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for exploring Rome. This small hotel looks nothing from the outside, tucked away in a side street, but the bedrooms have everything you would need, including TV, fridge, very well stocked tea/coffee tray (in fact the best selection of teas that I have ever seen in any hotel), napkins, and a real bottle opener (not just the cheap version). The rooms vary in as much not all are air conditioned nor have a balcony/terrace, (we had one of each style) but that is only to be expected given the lay out of the accommodation - just a few rooms on each floor off a spiral staircase; however, each of the rooms that we had was more than adequate in size, with spacious and well equipped bathroom. You do need to be fairly fit to cope with the staircase and your luggage, although reception is always manned and so someone can normally assist if necessary with the luggage; both reception and the breakfast room are situated on the first floor with bedrooms allocated on a further 3 floors. Access to the hotel is by pressing the buzzer on the outside wall of the side street, and the door opens leading to the spiral staircase. There is a small breakfast room which provides typical adequate choice for a self-service continental breakfast: orange juice, tea, fresh fruit, yoghurts, selection of individual cereals, cheese and meats, rolls and selection of packaged savoury biscuits, and of course, croissants, pastries and cake. There is always someone on hand to offer cappuccinos or espressos. Staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful, and speak good English. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Castel St. Angelo, the Vatican, The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, in fact most of the main tourist attractions although we did take the open top tour bus eventually as we only had 2 days in Rome and tried to see as much as possible without total exhaustion! There are numerous small bars around the hotel, as well as interesting individual small shops plus restaurants/cafes galore, many frequented by the locals. We enjoyed wonderful food, atmosphere and plenty of Prosecco, all reasonably priced, in around the side streets within walking distance of the hotel. Tips: we were told at the airport that taxi from the airport is a set charge of 30 Euros, however, our taxi driver told us that was to the centre, and not to our hotel; our final charge was 47 Euros although to our mind the hotel is very central indeed! The return journey by taxi, booked via the hotel, was only 35 Euros. If planning on walking around Rome you definitely need extremely comfortable, deep soled, foot attire as most of the streets are sets or cobbled and hard going on the feet! Overall impression: whilst the hotel is not fancy, more like an extremely good B&B, I would recommend it strongly and would certainly stay there again as and when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortbable, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Espedair
Reviews.Content: This lovely, small and very friendly hotel is well situated, only a few minutes from Piazza Navona, but in a quiet area. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful. Breakfast was good, continental-style. The hotel can be difficult to find on the first visit, with only a brass plate beside the door, in the very small via dei Tre Archi (which most Romans hadn't heard of--ask for via Coronari), but once found it is easy to navigate to. There is no lift and a steep stairs to reception and the bedrooms. Guests have no front door key and must ring for entry 24/7; occasionally it took some time for the door to be opened, but is very secure. The bedrooms were smallish but adequate, newly redecorated, comfortable and very clean and bright. It is a perfect location from which to see Rome, in the centre of the old city and a short walk from the Tiber, Vatican etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect & charming”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine_LC
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay here and found it absolutely perfect. It's central and within good walking distance for for everything (Piazza Novana is just around the corner) and there's a lovely little restaurant with good food right next door (the locals eat here too which is always a good sign). The hotel is clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful. Our room was a decent size and the bathroom was clean and spacious. I would definitely recommend this place if you want to take in the atmosphere of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Central, quiet and charming.”
Reviews.Author: Jennie F
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly simple but perfect for a stay in the heart of Rome. We had Room 42 with the small balcony above via dei Tre Archi - and it was amazingly quiet for such a central location. The reception staff were very helpful from booking right through to carrying our cases up to the room on arrival and down again when we left (no need for a gym/fitness centre with four flights of stairs to climb!) Until we got there, we hadn't appreciated how very close it was to all the most famous sights - and on very good bus routes just round the corner (via Zanardelli/Pzza. di Tor Sanguigna) too. We'd stay again and would happily to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: msu_mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights in early March. The location is wonderful, you can literally walk to almost anything you want to do in Rome. It is on a quiet side street so noise isn't an issue. We used their driver to get back and forth to the airport and we thought it was great, the cost was 50 euro each way and they provided excellent service. The room was a nice size for Europe, with a large armoire type closet. The bathroom was a good size too, with nice large towels. Everything was spotlessly clean. The room also had a kettle for tea. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was fine. We booked directly through their website and when they lowered the rate a few weeks before our trip, a quick email got us re-booked at the lower rate. Be aware that there is no elevator, so this isn't the place for you if stairs are a problem. There are no ground floor rooms. I wold have given the place 5 stars except for the beds. They are rock hard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: toadprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Residenza Canali Ai Coronari. The hotel is located on a pretty and quiet street near Piazza Navona, right in the centre of Rome, a perfect location for exploring the city. Staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. Our room was clean, tidy, warm and a good size; the bed was a little hard but we like that and slept well. The 'uplift' that people have referred to in other reviews seems to have been completed, we were quite happy with the decor. Breakfast was simple but all that we needed. Would highly recommend the hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel to visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: europeancouple2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights on the 4th floor of the hotel. The best thing about the hotel was its location. It is 200 meters from Piazza Navona and generally in the center of ancient Rome. We didn't need to use the subway or the bus to move around, apart from the Colosseum. Even during night hours it was very easy and safe to wonder around. The room was renovated and clean and also had an exclusive terrace. The only disadvantages that we noticed was that the breakfast was kind of poor with a small dining room and that the main door and stairs and halls were narrow (made it difficult for us to carry our luggages. Especially staying on the 4th floor meant that we had to move up and down the stairs several times a day.) Overall we liked this hotel and we would stay when visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marriedwithkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August. The room was very clean but could use a little updating. The air conditioning did not work well. We turned it up as high as possible and had the staff check it as the room was never cool enough. At times it was just plain uncomfortable. I generally am the person shutting off the air conditioning as I do not like it real cold. However, we never shut it off. The bathrooms are updated and clean. The breakfast is ample. The location cannot be beat. The hotel is easy walking to all the major sites. I would stay here but not in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley S
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took holiday here for a stay of four days - absolutely amazing! Not only was the location perfect, but the staff made the stay easy and were always pleasant/helpful. The breakfast was great and had something for everyone. The room was very nice and had a small fridge and a remodeled bathroom. The only negative that we both agreed on were the beds, they were too hard for our comfort. I will definitely recommend them to all of my friends, family and co-workers!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: okoshi2002
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for 5 nights in October. Because this was our first visit to Rome we knew we would want to see the major sites and have easy access to them by foot. This property is just off the Coronari which is a narrow ,charming street with numerous antiques shops and other small businesses. It's close proximity (minutes by foot) to the Piazza Navona is priceless, as the activities there at night are festive and eateries galore. We had a roof top room with a patio at the Residenza which was perfect for my husband and I though the climb up several flights of stairs is a necessity since there is not an elevator. This was not a problem. Everybody there were very friendly and helpful, readily ssisting us with maps, etc. The breakfast was always a treat as their expresso and capuccino are excellent. I should note there is a small supermarket on Coronari with a good deli and bakery goods making gathering of quick snacks very easy and pleasant. This was an excellent choice for us and felt very fortunate to have found it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great service...needs updating badly!”
Reviews.Author: kgrosso
Reviews.Content: I want to give this hotel 5 stars, but there are some things that they really need to address before I would recommend this hotel, or stay there again. - The bed is hard as a rock. By FAR the hardest bed I've ever slept in, it honestly was like sleeping on a carpeted floor. The two pillows were not any better. I honestly think the comfort of the bed is THE most important thing in a hotel, so...maybe it's time to replace the mattresses and make the rooms comfy? - The bedding coverlet and blanket really need to be replaced. They look and feel like they are 100% polyester from the 1970's. This would be so easy to update and would make such a difference in the comfort of the room! (The sheets were crisp white cotton, so that was great) - The shower had a folding screen contraption instead of a shower curtain. Every day I would wrestle it into place, and every time I got out of the shower there was a huge puddle on the floor. I noticed that the ceiling had large watermarks from the room above, so I'm obviously not the first person to have this problem with the shower screen. Get shower curtains! On the plus side, every person who works here is beyond helpful and extremely kind. The location is fantastic, the hotel building is gorgeous, and there was very little noise from the outside. I think the loudest thing I heard were the birds in the morning! Also, GREAT breakfast and fantastic coffee. Would love to stay here again....but I'll wait until they get the beds updated.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark111746
Reviews.Content: Met my brother in Rome for a 5-day visit (I live in the U.S. - he lives in Hungary), and we each had a single room at this centrally-located small hotel. It is well situated in the heart of the Centro Storico, near the Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and the Campo de' Fiori. We took walking day trips all over Rome -- the Foro & Colosseo, San Clemente, San Pietro in Vincoli, the Ghetto, Trastevere, the Villa Borghese and Piazza del Popolo, the Trevi Fountain, the Via Condotti & Spanish Steps -- and enjoyed some great nearby restaurants. The hotel had all the necessary amenities -- large rooms, free wifi, a computer for guest use, a good breakfast, a quiet backstreet location, and was reasonably priced. It did not, however, have an elevator, so be prepared for stairs. The hotel staff -- particularly Stefano and Antonio -- were extremely helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: RSV_Golpher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice during our tour of Italy. Our first stay was for the initial three nights after arriving in Rome. Our hosts paulo and Stefano were excellent and very helpful and knowledgeable. The accommodations were very comfortable and the location was just perfect. 15 minutes walking took you to the Spanish Steps-Trevi Fountain and the other durection in 15 minutes you were in St Peters Square. The Panthenon and Piazza Navona are so close. restaurants galore within 5 minutes walk. The morning breakfast was very very good.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome with great service”
Reviews.Author: MAC_LA1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the first leg of our honeymoon in Rome at Canali. Our first evening was in Miami with a canceled flight - I contacted Canali to let them know about the delay - rather than charging us for the night we were not there, they did not. This was one of the best surprises when we checked out! As for the room - top floor (no elevator but good workout after Italian meals) with a patio with a table and chairs; bathroom was upgraded; bedroom was large enough with comfortable bed, desk, refrigerator, and mounted TV. WIFI is free - don't forget to ask for the code. Great morning breakfast with regular coffee or espresso drinks - your choice. Central location to many sights in Rome. We highly recommend Residenza Canali! Note: if you are coming in from the airport after a long flight from the states, take the option they offer for a car to pick you up -- 50 Euro was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tt_stein
Reviews.Content: We are a couple that stayed at the Residenza Canali for 5 nights for the final leg of a 2-week trip in Italy. The stay at this hotel really helped making those last few days really great. First of all, the hotel is located right off Piazza Navona in a quiet street which means that almost all the major sights are within walking distance. This being my second time to Rome, this change in location improved the stay in Rome tremendously. The property itself is well-run, very clean, and serves a good breakfast. I think what really sets this place apart from others is the level of service you get from the entire staff, who were very informative and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay - twice!”
Reviews.Author: Renaissance11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the second time at Residenza Canali, and it was every bit as wonderful on this visit as it was on the last. First off, the location can’t be beat. It’s on an incredibly charming street that’s very quiet, so street noise won’t keep you awake at night. Second, it’s right in the heart of the city and within very short walking distance of lots of attractions. It’s steps away from Piazza Navona, and within a couple of minutes from the Pantheon, Café Sant’Eustachio, Campo de Fiori, and a lot of stunning churches that should not be missed, including San Luigi dei Francesi (which houses three stunning works by Caravaggio!). Other walkable attractions are the Vatican and the Trevi fountain. There is also a cab stand on the square right outside the hotel. The hotel’s perfect location is matched only by its fantastic staff and wonderful accommodations. Francesca and Stefano in particular are so warm and friendly and will do whatever it takes to make your stay an unforgettable one. On this particular visit I was supposed to have arrived on a Friday, but unfortunately I was bumped from my flight and didn’t get there until Saturday. I fully expected to still pay for Friday night, after all, it wasn’t their fault that the airline bumped me. But when I received the bill there was no charge for Friday; they absolutely wouldn’t hear of it. The rooms are very clean, and the water pressure in the shower is great (an important detail to me). My friends and I stayed on the top floor, and each room has a wonderful terrace where I sat outside and enjoyed a glass of prosecco in the warm Roman evenings. The rooms are equipped with air conditioners. There is one negative to this hotel that should be mentioned. It’s not a problem for me but could be for others, and that is that the hotel is in a very old building. It’s narrow, and there is no elevator. If stairs are a problem, Residenza Canali may not work for you. Aside from that, it’s a wonderful hotel and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in early September. The location was excellent, close to everything, yet quiet. The only transportation we used was back and forth to the airport! The staff was very helpful, especially Antonio who greated us. The entire staff was so accomodating and the rooms were spotless. We had a room with a terrace, it was a nice addition, but because our stay was so short were unable to use it much because there was so much to do in the area. We will definitely come back when we visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “hot Rome”
Reviews.Author: su-cool
Reviews.Content: we did stay in this very beautiful place for 3 nights , 2 of them in a double room , then we moved to a suite. we enjoyed it a lot , the location is perfect , just 3 minutes from piazza Navona . The rooms are good , the suite was really nice and the breakfast , served in a small room which reminds of an old dining room , was good .The cheese is mixed with ham which is a bit of bad for vegetarians. Stuff is very friendly and helpful . which is missing to 5 stars is for my opinion a bit more niceness , like a free water in the room , some fruits or a welcoming bottle of wine . but otherwise very recomendable , i would like to visit again. the suite has a lot of space and a good view over the roofs of the city

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vacationers921
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel in Rome located right beside our most favourite spot - the Piazza Navona. Although a little difficult to find once we were inside we found the rooms to be very comfortable with air conditioning and all the amenities required. This is a family hotel - the breakfast was super and the hotel is close to all historical sites in Rome. Just around the corner is a cab location just in case transportation is required We had a great stay and we very much enjoyed the hospitality extended to us.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: The_Mellors
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have asked for anything more from this discrete hotel tucked away off the Piazza Navona. Very welcoming reception Lots of local information Beautfully decorated and spotlessly clean with lots of character. Most sites within a 15-20 minute walk. Generous breakfast - although the water could have been hotter for the tea!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pelirr0ja
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here with our two boys (10 & 14yrs). We had a suite which was really two rooms - one with a Queen size bed and the other with a two twins and a desk and an en suite bathroom. The room was immaculately clean. It was hot during out stay and the AC kept us just comfortable enough. The best part of the hotel, aside from the friendly helpful staff that made us cappuccino to order at b'fast, was the location. Barely a block from Piazza Navona and a few minutes from the Pantheon, we enjoyed the hotel's neighborhood the most. You would be missing out if you didn't explore the narrow, windy streets along the Via de Coronari...some of them opened onto small squares that came alive with restaurants, bars and shops. It was also an easy walk to Castel Sant Angelo and St. Peter's Square. Great place for a visitor on the go not needing a "resort" atmosphere. Every morning when I woke up and opened the shutters to the cool morning street and early sounds of the city I thought, "this is Rome!"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Noreen Chan
Reviews.Content: You do need to climb one flight of stairs to access the hotel, which is on a side street off Via Ai Coronari, but everything else about it cannot be faulted. It's well located for all the main site, and almost everything you might want to see is within half an hour's walk. Piazza Navona is a few minutes' away. The place is clean and comfortable, there is wireless access, and the breakfast spread is generous. I love the staff - they are so helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, clean.”
Reviews.Author: Mac E
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our 2 teenagers stayed here in June 2011 for 3 nights. Antonio, the night staff-person, made it an exceptional stay. He was friendly, respectful, honest, and gave us good advice on local restaurants. Without Antonio the hotel was still a good value, with clean rooms, comfortable beds, and a great location. We stayed on the top floor, with a terrace, which I would not recommend unless you are prepared to walk up 5 flights of stairs. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem at Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: Cozmot
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. Some close friends passionately recommended Residenza Canali, both for its fabulous location at Piazza Navona and for the exquisite service at this modest boutique hotel. How right they were. First, it must be noted that the hotel has no elevator, which is very important for anyone has trouble walking up stairs. The hotel lobby is a flight above ground level, so you have to take stairs. The same goes to get to your room on a winding staircase. If you have no trouble with stairs, then this leads me to a very important recommendation: have the hotel reserve a driver to pick you up. This is not only to avoid the long cab lines at the airport, but also because the driver will bring in your luggage and help the staff carry it up to your room. We arrived in Rome early in the morning from an overnight flight from Washington, DC. The driver was a welcome sight, and gave us a min-tour coming into the city. We arrived at the hotel too early for our rooms to be ready, so we registered and left our luggage to the hotel and driver’s care, and then headed out to a café our friends recommended for the best cappuccino in Rome (Sant’Eustachio il caffé). This was another terrific recommendation, although we had cappuccino elsewhere and never had any that was less than very good. After touring Santa Maria sopra Minerva (The Basilica of Saint Mary Above Minerva) and then the Pantheon, we headed back to the hotel. Our rooms were ready, and they were fantastic. There are just two rooms on the top floor, each with a private terrace. The views are fantastic and what a wonderful place to lounge. We used the terrace in the morning with coffee, in the late afternoons with wine and cheese and in the evenings after dinner for a glass of wine. Naturally, the rooms with terraces cost more than the other rooms, but if you can afford it, get it! This enhanced our stay more than I can express. Nevertheless, if you can’t afford or reserve one of these rooms, don’t let this stop you. Stay at this quaint hotel anyway. There’s a small dining room where you have a free breakfast (pastries, breakfast meats, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc.). There’s coffee (“American coffee, they call it) and tea, but don’t dip into that the coffee that quickly, because the staff will come in and ask you if you want a cappuccino or espresso (no extra charge). If you want ice for your room, just ask for it at the front desk. We had a mini fridge in our room, but I don’t know if they have one in every room. There’s also free wifi in the rooms, and for those of you who travel with a computer, there’s one that you can use for free in the lobby. There’s a nice convenience store just down the narrow street, where you can buy wine, water, snacks, food and sundries, plus it has a deli. This was very convenient. There are terrific restaurants within very easy walking distance. Plus, there’s a taxi stand in the plaza by the hotel. When it was time to check out, the staff was very helpful in helping us carry down our luggage (the driver, who wasn’t the one who drove us there, wasn’t walking up that spiral staircase!). The staff was very friendly and helpful at all times, and helped make this a memorable experience. In my opinion, there is no better a location to stay in Rome, and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: octopal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 7 nights in Rome. Location of Residenza Canali is the best. You can walk everywhere, and the Piazza Navona is seconds away-the best place to sit and enjoy a glass of wine or espresso. Friendly English speaking staff, clean, affordable. Well worth the extra few minutes it took for us to find it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: kay67
Reviews.Content: More like a bed and breakfast, but it's a hotel. The family who run it are really nice people. It is "Euro medium" sized place. Not a small place for Europe, but surely not a typical American sized place. It is clean and comfortable, and they have a very nice typical Italian breakfast spread on the main floor. There is no elevator, so if you don't mind a couple of flights of stairs, this is a great spot. It is situated halfway between the Vatican and the Trevi Fountain, and about a two minute walk from the Piazza Navona. There are loads of really yummy restaurants a very short walk from here. And, right up ai Coronari is a small piazza with a fountain..it's right there that you'll find a great little restaurant with a bar, and it was our favorite spot to have a nightcap after sending our kids back to the room for the night. The bartender is the brother of the chef and the father is there to supervise everything! They were really kind...try the Aperol Spritz at the bar. Back to the hotel...there are no special amenities here. No pool, spa, fitness or business centers. It is basic and it's all you could need. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: AnnetteRome
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Rome, after staying at the Residenza Canali. I absolutely loved it here. The staff was amazing. They went out of their way to accommodate their guests. For example, I asked for directions to my school, and Antonio actually walked me to it so I wouldn't get lost. When I had to change my reservations due to my flight cancellation, Francesca and the other staff actually got on the phone with the airline to help me. It was like staying with family in Rome! The weather was very warm, but the hotel room had a great air conditioning unit which kept me cool. I upgraded to a room with a terrace, which I highly recommend. The bathroom was modern and the lighting was great (important to us women of a certain age). Only proviso, I opted for the top floor, but would be tough if you were not in good shape. They are working on getting the elevator approved, so it may not be a concern in the future. Super clean and comfy bed too. The internet worked great from my room which cannot be said of lots of hotels in Rome. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: almostfamous7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of our 2nd honeymoon. The hotel is situated in a perfect location (near Piazza Navona), and was about 5-15 minutes away from all areas. The room was of adequate size, but the temperature in the room was at times rather warm (which was also somewhat expected). Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: JAG458
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a quick trip to Rome. I have to say that our trip overlapped with the beatification of JP2, so we were quite worried about the crowds of pilgrims (not to mention the difficulty in finding a hotel). We found this hotel to be exactly as advertise--nice, clean, and with a great location off the piazza navona (but on a quite side street). The room itself is pretty simple, but in my opinion you dont book a hotel in rome for the room. The breakfast is also quite simple classic continental with fresh cappucino. The location is what makes this place as it is in walking distance of almost anything in rome. In addition, the staff was friendly and helpful. Only advice is that it is very hard to find on such a small street (it took the tourist office at the piazza resorting to google earth) so make sure you have a good plan before arriving (our rec is the bus--not the train--from the airport and get off at the vatican stop which is only a 10-15 min walk to the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Giraffe26
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice stay here! The hotel is just around the corner from the Piazza Navona. The neighborhood is a charming network of narrow alleyways. The staff was very friendly and there was free internet access in the lobby. The room was comfortable, renovated and larger than we expected. The breakfast was very good and they bought me 3 different kinds of gluten-free bread! I would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms, good staff”
Reviews.Author: jennypenny12
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the location of the hotel. It was located near Piazza Navona, but on a charming side street that was not inundated with tourists. Rooms were spacious and charming. We could not hear any outside street noise, but we could hear the people above us moving about (which I would usually expect in most hotels). The air conditioners worked very well and the controls were located in the room and would stay on while we were away (not sure if many people are aware that in most European hotels, you have to insert your key in order for the electricity to work in the room). Breakfast was adequate with fresh pastries and made-to-order cappuccino. Overall, most of the staff was helpful and attentive, except for one... The only complaint that we had was on the evening that we were leaving. We had arranged transportation for 5:45 in the morning. We turned in early (10pm) to try to get as much rest as possible. Around 12:15am, we are dead asleep and we hear a knocking on our door! I thought there was something wrong and I was alarmed. The man knocking on our door was requesting the we come and pay for our stay before we leave. I was genuinely appalled at the situation. My husband went a settled our "check out" and he didn't even get an apology. I let the management know the next day by email and they were very apologetic. We would probably return again, hoping next time that we won't be disturbed in the middle of the night!

Reviews.Title: “When next we return to Rome, we will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: RickE1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Canali for 2 days before and 1 day after a Med cruise. I was excited when we booked it because of all the positive comments on this site. I must say, we were not disappointed! The lack of an elevator is an issue (especially at the start of a 2 1/2 week vacation), but the staff was very friendly and helped us carry the bags up. Francesca was wonderful to work with prior to the trip. The first 2 days we upgraded to a terrace room and it was wonderful. On the trip back we stayed in a standard double. It was about the size I expect in a European boutique hotel. luckily, we were able to leave our luggage downstairs in a closet this time. We had dinner at the restaurant beside the hotel and it was wonderful. They kept trying to get us reservations for the Osteria Pegno, but they were always booked. No problem! Thank you to Francesca and all the staff for the hospitality. You are the best! We are planning to come back to Rome next year and will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: LanternFive
Reviews.Content: Our party of five greatly enjoyed our stay at the Residenza Canali ai Coronari in Rome, The staff were great and extremely attentive to our needs. They arranged for a van to pick us up at the Rome Train Terminal which made our trip much easier. Staff suggested great restaurants and made arrangements for us with some old favorites, If you are looking for an economical, centrally located small hotel close to th Pantheon, the Residenza Canali ai Coronari should be a spot to consider. Best Hotel breakfast we had during a 16 day trip in France & Italy [there was that B & B in Provence, though...]

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Rome - gave us an experience we won't forget”
Reviews.Author: FitzLee
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip, we wanted to stay somewhere where we felt like we truly could experience what the city of Rome was really like. The Residenza Canali was everything we hoped for...and more! The hotel is a gem in the heart of the city and we couldn't have been more pleased. We were close to everything, felt like we were living the lifestyle and our teenage daughters had the time of their lives. The staff was incredibly friendly, the hotel was very clean, and the service was great. This hotel helped make our family vacation one we'll never frorget. I recommend this anyone who truly wants to experience life in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: viczi
Reviews.Content: The three of us, 2 adults + 1 child (10) were staying at the hotel for four nights. The suite room was large enough for us, clean, with modern appliances which functioned well. The breakfast was excellent, with great variety and fresh products. Location is very convenient to get to major sites, especially the Vatican area. Even the walk to Colliseum was pleasant and not too long. The staff was great, providing detailed instructions, and great dinner recommendations. I must mention that prior to the trip their customer service went beyond what would normally be expected. Francesca was very kind and made a last minute change to the reservation which would normally bear a charge under the terms of the reservation. She graciously waived the charge thus setting up a warm mood prior to our visit. The hotel is definitely recommended. It's both great value and satisfies the highest standards of service normally expected from 4-and 5-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “would definately return!”
Reviews.Author: mumbles30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and we were able to walk to all sights all the way from the Colisseum to the Vatican. The walk was long to the Colisseum but the weather was perfect in April for the walk. If you prefer to take the bus or taxi they are easily accessible. The hotel is kept very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. There are a variety of pastries offered at breakfast along with fresh fruits and cereals. An added bonus is having tea and coffee in the room and I really appreciated this. My only complaint was that the beds were hard but I found this common in all of the hotels we stayed in throughout Europe. We slept with the windows open and heard a lot of noise late at night with people leaving bars/restaurants but since this is a city it was not unexpected and we could fall back to sleep quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: cait730
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for sightseeing in Rome. Its located steps from Piazza Navona and is walking distance to most of the sights. The staff was wonderful- extremely helpful and welcoming. The rooms were nice, well appointed and most importantly clean. Definitely would go back!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was excellent”
Reviews.Author: ksh1elds555
Reviews.Content: For a budget minded traveler, this place could not have been better or the people nicer. The location is incredible, just a block away from the Piazza Navona and walking distance to the Vatican and other sites. It is a small hotel, not fancy but with a very cozy feel to it. The hotel staff went out of their way to do nice things for my us. The breakfast was good and had a lot of variety. We were in Rome in January and it was pretty cold most days. We came back to the room to warm towels, a spotless room, a comfy bed, a nice hot bath.... I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Rome, we will stay at this wonderful little place with owners and staff that treated us like family.”
Reviews.Author: SaSa36
Reviews.Content: We have traveled much and Residenza Canali has to be one of our most pleasant stays!With Stefan, a sweet, caring and attentive person. Antonio, intellectual, curious, conversationalist, and Max, lover of life......just go with his restaurant recomendations! All at the front desk, Francesca and her brother, and all the ladies that served us wonderful cappuccino.....even momma were terrific! We miss them! Rooms and bath were spotlessly clean, and they even double sheeted the blanket for us! Nice ample supply of towels too. This charming little place (10 rooms) is in the middle of Rome! Attractions in all directions, 5min stoll from Piazza Navona, charming side street location with antique shops, great restaurants. We loved our room. Not elegant, but charming. Check out the photos on their website and see what we mean. It had own rooftop terrace, to enjoy sun, birds, rooftop views, a place to enjoy wine or bring your breakfast up (4 flights of stairs!!) Wonderful! The staff were interested in our daily experiences, helpful in arranging reservations for sights, meals and drivers. There was nothing we didn't like about this hotel, considering the type that it is. Sure, one grander may have plusher bedding, but it was just fine. So if you want down and all that, this is not the place for you.....but you will be missing out on a wonderful total package that is often hard to find! We haven't stopped talking about out wonderful experience there, and what a perfect time we had!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoWolverine
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Rome and was traveling alone, so I was pleasantly surprised when greeted by name and offered a delicious cappuccino upon walking through the door. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for walking to all the main attractions and a taxi stand is close by. The breakfast was yummy and the room was clean. The reason for the 3 on the sleep quality is because every morning at the crack of dawn, very loud birds that sounded like babies crying congregated in the nearby piazza (Piazza Navona - fabulous). Due to the weather, I had the window open, and the birds were really annoying. If the window was closed, I don't think you would hear them. LOVED the free computer in the lobby. I felt safe and comfortable, like I was staying at a friend's home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Wonderful Management”
Reviews.Author: Matt1NYC
Reviews.Content: After multiple trips to Rome, we've stayed here the last two times and will not need to consider anywhere else in the future. It is a very nice small hotel on a quiet street just a block north of Piazza Navona. The location is ideal and the hotel is clean and well kept, with a very attentive staff. For both stays, we arrived very early in the morning, before our room was available (because the prior guests had not yet checked out). They checked us in, told us that they would hold our bags while we went out and explored Rome, and gave us towels and a very nice washroom where we could change our clothes and wash up. They just could not have been any more friendly and welcoming. When we got back to the hotel after taking in the sights and having lunch, our bags were in our room. On our last trip, we learned of a death in the family on the second day of what was supposed to be a four day stay at the hotel. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. They helped us arrange flights to get home the next day and negotiated with our airline for us when we had difficulty because we did not speak Italian. They would have had every right to charge us for the full four nights that we had reserved, but they did not. They also refused to charge us for the ten or more international phone calls that we made from our room. They just offered their condolences and said that they recognized it was an emergency. It is easy for hotel staff to be accommodating when everything is going well. It is quite another thing for them to go out of their way to help when something that is not their responsibility goes very wrong. Even if the location were not so perfect (which it is) and even if the hotel were not so well kept (which it is), we would keep coming back because we were treated as though we were family members. How often can you say that about a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent, friendly service at a great price for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfromMemphis
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay at Residenza Canali and I was not disappointed in the decision. It is very well located to the Piazza Navona, which is my favorite base for getting around Rome. The rooms are very pleasant, well appointed and clean and the staff is excellent. We had a 4 am taxi to the airport and the staff had coffee and fruit available for us. I have seen complaints that there is no elevator and although that is true the staff carried our "very heavy" bags to our room for us. I was also told by the charming Stefano that the owners are working on a plan to add an elevator so check with them before your trip if this is your only concern.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great First Impression of Italian Hospitality!!! We will return!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGirl53
Reviews.Content: Aug 2010 was our first trip to Europe and to Rome. I researched Trip Advisor for the best place to stay near Piazza Navona. Friends recommended another bed and breakfast but the reviews advised of a noisey night club down the street so I thought I would research to find something better. Boy was I glad I did as I found the most lovely bed and breakfast we could have imagined. Everything that everyone is saying is true. During our stay we met all the staff Stefano, Antonio, Mario and Paolo, I emailed Francesca while arranging our stay but never met her! They were all fantastic and so helpful. We felt so at home there. Our friends didnt get the terrace room the first night due to a mix up and the next day their bags were moved and a beautiful bottle of wine awaited them also with a room discount!!! We stayed for two nights before our cruise and then at the end of our vacation stayed another night before leaving beautiful Italy. Stefano offered to make reservations for us at Santa Lucia the restaurant around the corner under the trees (Eat Pray Love) which we should have accepted but waited to long and couldnt get a reservation until 9:30 so we ended up eating at Piazza Navona which really was the best way to end our trip to Italy with the ambience, music, people, fountains aaaah!!! I love Rome! Thank you all the staff at Residenza Canali, we will return and we will stay with you again!! Kevin and Gale Tracey, Surrey, BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Helped make my stay in Rome so enjoyable I wanted to go straight back”
Reviews.Author: Janey014
Reviews.Content: My third visit to Rome now but my first time staying at this particular hotel. I arrived late on the Sunday evening following my flight and had a very easy check-in with a member of the hotels' ever helpful staff who during the whole stay could not have been more accommodating. The room we were in was pleasant, the bathroom was spacious and clean with housekeeping coming to the room each day. Breakfast was available each morning in a small cosy room within the hotel, the time we went it was relatively quiet so managed to get a seat no problem and there was plenty of choice and staff were well on top of things to ensure there were no shortages. We were able to leave our bags with them after we checked out as our flight home wasn't until the evening and they let us use their facilities to freshen up before we left. The location of the hotel is perfect in the centre of Roma, you are close to Piazza Navona without literally being on top of it. We were within walking distance of tourist attractions, in fact we didn't need to use any taxis, metros or buses during the trip to get us to where we wanted to be. I would definitely recommend Residenza Canali ai Coronari as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You're not going to believe this incredible customer service story.”
Reviews.Author: m_kandl
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Italy generally once or twice a year for the past 15 years either for a vacation, business, or personal family occasions, and always stay at the Residenza Canali. Here is why: Residenza Canali hotel is always consistent, is an absolutely lovely, impecably clean hotel, and the staff and owners have always gone well out of their way to provide stellar customer service with that real Italian warmth and congeniality, all at a fair price. I have never experienced any lack of cleanliness or insufficient air-conditioning as one person wrote. I started staying there over 10 years ago and have traveled every city and region in Italy. I prefer small, private, intimate hotels with a 4 star rating, like the Residenza Canali because you have all the services of a big hotel, in a well-appointed, lovely atmosphere as well as a home-like touch. ( I even go to breakfast in my slippers sometimes). The food is much better quality than the big hotels. As a trained pastry chef, I really appreciate the aroma of warm FRESH baked goods wafting out of the breakfast room and the tantalizing perfume of espresso or cappucino. American/English coffee is always available too, but then why am I in Italy if I don't drink their coffee as well as their culture? The location really is fabulous. It is literally a few steps from Piazza Navona and a close walk to many major attractions, such as the Pantheon, St. Peters, Sistine Chapel, and theTrevi Fountain. Though it is in the heart of the city, it is situated on a very quaint small back street which is alway quiet and gives you the feeling of being in small town Italy. You have access to everything you need in the immediate vicinity. There is a pharmacy, a taxi stand, city tourist information & bus stops practically right out your front door. Of course numerous shops, gelaterias, resturants, and a nearby grocery store go without saying. Indeed the best bakery in Rome is located again a few steps from the hotel. I usually have them pack up a Kilo of Italian cookies for the plane and delight my friends and family when I return home. Then, one of the best Wine shops (Enoteca) in Rome is located in Piazza Cavour, about 15 minutes walk. As a wine professional I can tell you they have the best selection of wines in Rome. I once counted 52 different producers of Brunello di Montalcino. The staff can direct you to the store. Residenza Canali has always gone out of their way to help me navigate the city with trains, busses, etc. They have even helped me make phone calls to old Italian relatives who spoke mostly dialects, and acted as translators for me. About 5 years ago, they even arranged for a wheelchair for me to bring my elderly, handicapped mother with me. None of the other hotels in other cities would help me out. The most incredible act occured this Septmber when my cell phone was not working properly in Italy , though it had worked well many times in the past. All my business contacts and family members could not reach me. I was desperate and embarrassed. Though I tried everything, all the special chips and phone cards were not working. I was panicked because I made an error and had missed my train which was taking me to a rental car location where I was to pick up a car to drive to a relative's wedding. The rental car office was closing for the weekend. Stefano, a long time employee at Residenza Canali, telephoned the office, explained my situation and coaxed them into opening up the store for me when I was able to make the next train. The office manager of the car rental office had to make special arrangements because she was at a funeral, so I really needed communication, both to pick up my car and to keep in contact with my relatives waiting for me at the other end. After all these problems, I was in danger of missing the last train going to my relatives. Stefano literally ran with me to a couple of stores nearby to try to buy an Italian phone for me at an economical price. After no luck, he offered me his own personal phone with the understanding that I would return it to him the next year. In addition, he was able to contact a car to bring my husband and I and our 150 overstuffed bags of luggage to the train station. I was able to finally get in touch with all my personal and business contacts, to pick up my car during off hours and not miss my cousin's wedding. I was in awe that Stefano went beyond the call of duty in his customer service efforts to be sure I got to my car, and the wedding, as well as reinstating my communication for me. It was as though he had a personal stake in my misadventures. Grazie Mille Stefano e Residenza Canali !

Reviews.Title: “A real find!”
Reviews.Author: rockymtngirl65
Reviews.Content: If you want a 'perfect' location - this is it! Walking distance to most sites in the historic center.Rooms were spacious, quiet, nicely presented and immaculate. The bathrooms are modern and there is also air conditioning. This boutique type hotel also has helpful and friendly staff, that were eager to please! The breakfast selection was well beyond standard. We stayed in Room 24 and our friends in Room 22. we would highly recommend this hotel without hesitation. Well priced too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: 255060Sue
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at this little B&B and was very happy. Fabulous location around the corner from Piazza Navona. The room was not big but clean, and all the staff were very helpful and friendly (they carried my huge suitcase down 3 flights of stairs!). The little breakfast room was well stocked with a lovely choice of fresh bread/cereal/yoghurt and fruit, and they make a great cappuccino. It doesn't have a lift and we couldn't get any English speaking programs on the TV, but it was clean and convenient, and as I was travelling on my own, I felt comfortable there. I will definitely stay again when next in Rome. Sue

Reviews.Title: “Splendido!”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all of the qualities I was looking for. Spotlessly clean. Fabulous location. I enjoyed quiet comfortable sleep. I stayed in room 32. It had a comfortable double bed and was furnished with antiques. The modern bathroom (with a bathtub) was finished in white marble and tile. The air conditioning cooled the room perfectly. A few other reviewers complained about the breakfast room and the variety of food offered, but I found the breakfast room to be quite pleasant, and the food very tasty. The coffee was not good, but all I had to do was ask for cappuccino and they brought it to me immediately, and it was delicious. The food included the most wonderful flaky croissants I've ever tasted. They also had a variety of meats and cheeses, breads, cakes, fresh fruit, yogurt, fruit juice, jellies, Nutella, tea, milk and cereal. Yes, there were stairs, but the owner, Lena, graciously carried my suitcase to my room. Unless you are physically unable to walk up stairs or have tons of luggage, the stairs shouldn't be a problem. I would stay at the Residenzia Canali again, and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, ideal location, wonderful and sincere staff!”
Reviews.Author: DancesWithTrout
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Residenza in July 2010, for 3 nights. We loved every aspect of it. The location near Piazza Navona is great--easy walking distance to the Pantheon and other sights, and convenient access to buses (very handy). Despite this, the inn is set back by a couple of streets, so that it's very, very quiet. We didn't have much of a view from our room, but the windows did allow plenty of daylight. We also stayed at a place next to the Colosseum, but we saw no one but other tourists and police--in the Piazza Navona area we felt we got a deeper immersion into the "feel" of Roma's neighborhoods. Yes, there are stairs. We didn't find that to be a problem, even with the luggage, because we knew in advance what to expect (Thanks TripAdvisor!). And also, the staff offered repeatedly to help us with the bags. The air conditioning was very effective, and very welcome in mid-July. Breakfast was great. Very fresh meats, cheeses, pastries, and fruits--very tasty. Best coffee. After reading some previous reviews, we were unsure what to expect in terms of cleanliness. I'm happy to say that our room and bathroom were spotless, immaculate. I don't know what happened to the other people who wrote reviews, but we were very impressed with the cleanliness of our bathroom. And we were even more impressed with the staff. They answered emails promptly before our arrival, welcomed us warmly when we checked in (even allowed my wife to check in early, since we arrived separately), joked with us and other guests during our stay, and helped us with directions/suggestions/bus routes with cheerfulness and charm. We could tell they sincerely cared about the experience of the guests. We felt the rate was quite reasonable. We would definitely go back to the Residenza, without hesitation, on our next visit to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “This is where you want to stay.”
Reviews.Author: AllenJackArmstrong
Reviews.Content: First is the location. The Piazza Navona is just bursting with positive energy, people from all over the world, amazing artists and performers, great restaurants, unforgettable architecture. It's close enough to walk to the Colosseum, the Forum, the Vatican, the Tiber, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, etc. If you don't feel like walking, there's a taxi stand right in of the hotel, and buses to every part of the city stop just a block away. Then there is the hotel. From the Piazza, you go just a few steps around the corner, into a quiet (but very safe) alley, through an ancient, beautiful, secret-looking door into a private little world of calm and comfort. The concierges - Stefano and Marco - were as fluent in English as I am, very knowledgeable, and eager to help us navigate our first time in Rome. The lobby is lovely and completely informal, with a computer you can use. The rooms are beautiful. Classic Roman architecture, recently renovated to the highest standards, and immaculately kept. Each room had a nicely-stocked refrigerator. One of our rooms had an outdoor terrace overlooking the surrounding rooftops. Go for one of those if you can. Breakfast was some of the best food we had in Italy, which is saying a lot. The Residenza Canali was maybe our favorite hotel ever.

Reviews.Title: “It is a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: unoconleche
Reviews.Content: The staff kindly greeted us and were most professional. The bellhop was extremely kind and helpful as well. As for the rooms-- they were absolutely amazing! Clean, spacious and simply gorgeous. The location is ideal as well. Although in the heart of the very busy San Marco Square, it was surprisingly quiet and peaceful. We were all amazed by the service and style of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, dirty bathrooms, breakfast could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Lajo
Reviews.Content: Pros: (1) The location of this small residenza can't be beat - steps from Piazza Navona, and walking distance to the Vatican and the Trevi fountain. The hotel is located on a quaint street of antique stores and quiet restaurants. We loved being so centrally located. (2) Room size - We had a large room with two windows overlooking the main street below and a small sitting room for the kids (2 cots set up for them.) (3) A/C - the air conditioning worked great in both rooms which was a plus because Rome had a heat wave when we were there and it also helped with the noise from the street while sleeping. Cons - (1) Mold growing all along the grout in the bathtub and up the walls. We complained and they said they would come clean it but never did. This is such a simple fix and would have made so much difference in our feel for the place. (2) Breakfast - the worst of all our hotels on the trip (we stayed in 5 hotels throughout in Italy on this trip). The tiny room has about 8-10 small tables and a "buffet" offering boxed cereals, yogurts, some rolls/meat/cheeses, the coffee was the worst coffee we have EVER tasted, thankfully we could get weak cappaccinos but the coffee tasted like dirt - literally. (3) no elevator - be warned that if you have to walk up several flight of a small winding staircase to get to your room. This is a bare-bones residenza in a terrific location but will probably stay somewhere else nearby when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, cute and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beans2000
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the amazing location--right by Piazza Navona. We had 3 days in Rome, enjoy walking everywhere and wanted to be in the middle of things. This was the right choice for that. We were right by the river and so able to go running or walking along in the mornings/evenings. We were in the historic center/Navona where there are a lot of great restaurants and bars. Walking to the Vatican and Coliseum were 30 minutes (in opposite directions). The hotel did not have free wi-fi, but did have a computer you could use for free when it was available. We ordered a room with 2 beds and got 2 rooms (like a suite) with one bed each. The rooms were pretty and spacious for Europe, the beds were nice and firm, the rooms had a safe and were clean. The bathroom was spacious but we did notice that there was mold growing on the shower ceiling (the only negative thing about the room). The breakfast was decent--had cereals, pastries, cheese, bread. No eggs but that seemed to be the norm for about half of the places. Most of the hotel staff were helpful and able to speak English. I would definitely recommend this place if you want to stay in the middle of things and don't have much time in Rome. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe how great this place is!”
Reviews.Author: intrepid_apple
Reviews.Content: We wanted a family-friendly, central hotel with character and within budget and Residenza Canali ticked all the boxes. The location is ideal - right next to the bustle of Piazza Navona but on a less-touristy street. The staff were always friendly and helpful; helping with bags and recommending restaurants or booking ones we had chosen. We had a baby with us and one downside was having to carry the pushchair up the stairs (had it been a smaller pushchair perhaps we could have left it in the entrance, but we took a three-wheeler to cope with the cobbled streets!). The bedrooms were tastefully decorated though our bathroom was small and there was no bath. THere is a roof terrace but this is only open to guests in certain rooms. The breakfast was better than in other Roman hotels I have stayed in. Didn't try the coffee so I can't comment on that. There were lots of returning guests - always a good sign. Our only complaint was the pillow was a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: roncyfumi
Reviews.Content: Great location near Piazza Navona. No elevator but all was pretty and clean. Our room number 41 was at the top (4th floor) with a beautiful and big terrace. No noise from the street but we kept windows closed. Room was spacious and clean. Nice old style roof and wooden floor and furniture. Bath with shower but working good for us! Breakfast was enough, really good cakes and pastry. Don't forget to ask for coffee "espresso" and "cappuccino", they'll prepare for you just in time. Also nice staff: really helpful! Ask them for info about places to eat what you like (from pizza to kosher).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JSL_IL
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is fantastic - just next to Piazza Navona. The staff was always willing to help and were friendly to us. Breakfast was good and kept us happy for a few hours. The room was clean and so was the bathroom which was surprisingly spacious (we expected a smaller bathroom...). The room itself wasn't very large, but wasn't too small either - I guess it's not a bad size in Rome (and other European capitals) standards. We used the hotel's airport transfer services and would recommend to others to use - Alex who took us back to the airport was friendly and nice in particular! They currently don't have an elevator, but I think they are going to install one soon. The heating worked well in our room (we hardly needed it though) and the hotel staff told us that in May they switch to cooling. There is a computer in the lobby for guests usage and they let us use the hotel's printer for printing our boarding passes. A couple of things to note - our room window faced via di Coronary and it was a little noisy at nights. It wasn't a big issue for us as we were so tired and slept very well. Also closing the window eliminated the noise, but at the expense of fresh air. The other thing which might be worthwhile noting is that they only had Italian speaking channels on TV - again not a problem for us as we were hardly interested in TV. Bottom line - we enjoyed Rome very much and we enjoyed the Residenza Canali. We would definitely stay there again in a future visit and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: apv2636
Reviews.Content: The location of this "hotel" makes it very worth it. It is just a block away from Piazza Novona and centrally located to the main areas of Rome. Breakfast is included in the price of this room and is well worth it (cereal, juice, coffee, meat tray, pasteries, fruit, yogurt). The hotel is in a pedestrian only area so it is quieter than most and the windows help to block out any further noise caused by the streets. It is seconds away from great restaurants (there is one right around the corner on Tre Archi which I highly reccommend). My only suggestion for this hotel would be to purchase some new matresses or some foam matress pads as the beds are quite hard. Because the hotel only has a small spiral staircase, the beds have to be twin beds, but a foam matress cover would make them much more comfortable. The staff is very helpful in making reccomendations. They offer a limosine service from the airport to the hotel for 50euro. We used public transport and a cab to get TO the hotel and were not impressed with public transport in Rome and were charged a hefty fee by a cab driver. On the ride back to the airport we used Canali's limo service. The driver was very helpful and friendly and a perfect way to end our stay. I would reccomend the use of this service to EVERYONE staying here. Well worth the 50 euro. While there is not internet service in each room there is a computer in the lobby that the staff will let you use for a few minutes here and there. It would be nice for the hotel to upgrade and provide internet service in each room but it wasn't a reason to not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Roma!”
Reviews.Author: Cavalli62
Reviews.Content: This place has become a favourite. The staff is friendly. Our room, charming and the bathroom, clean and modern. The location is ideal, right off the gorgeous Piazza Navona. Don't miss the 'Blue Ice' for some of the city's best gelato. We walked all over the city from this hotel, including superb 'al fresco' dining each evening. (Don't take a horse drawn carriage ride. They are not romantic, but abusive. The horses are forced to work under inhumane conditions. This is a cruel industry.) Breakfast was ample and delicious, including fresh pastries and tortes each morning. The dining room could become very crowded however. Complimentary internet in the lobby was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: bblumberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on Rick Steves' guidebook. For once, Steves was right. This is an extraordinary B&B. Rooms are exceptional, the staff friendly and helpful and the location absolutely perfect for exploring Rome on foot. Outstanding breakfast as well. Highly recommended. We will definitely stay there the next time we visit Rome. Rome is magnificent but we highly recommend visiting at a time other than summer when the city is not packed with tourists

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirkcaldy67
Reviews.Content: For our second visit to Rome in as many years, my girl friend and I picked this hotel to get a more central location and more central, it certainly is!! It’s only a couple of minutes from the very lively Piazza Navona and within stumbling distance of many fine restaurants (all recommended by the staff). In about 5 minutes you can be standing in the Piazza Della Rotunda staring at Pantheon and most other "major" sites are within easy walking distance. The hotel is in the Via Coronari which is a very interesting and quaint old street full of antique shops, clothes shops, squares and churches. The street serves as a useful short cut to Castel Sant'Angelo and to top it off, great espresso's can be had at the nearby Caffe Coronari. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are fine and the breakfast is adequate. However the coffee could be worked on! All in all, a great stay and I will definitely stay here when I'm next in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms with private terrace in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Aldo_nova
Reviews.Content: This small hotel just off Piazza Navona makes it convenient to walk everywhere. The small street it sits on is quiet for Rome with great antique shops, neighbourhood cafes and trattorias. Spluge a little and stay on the top floor in one of 2 rooms with terraces. You will feel like you are living in Rome. There is no elevator so 3 flights to your room may be hard on some but was no problem for us. Friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast is adequate but they could improve the coffee. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little gem in Rome - great location and charming!”
Reviews.Author: HoosierGirl09
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel while in Italy. It doesn't have all the frills you would want if you like chains or big hotels (only 10 rooms) but we loved the intimate feel of being in the streets of Rome and the area was great. The staff was so sweet and we don't feel like we were overcharged. Internet available for free and the breakfast was nice in the morning. Just a cozy feeling. They can set a shuttle from the airport, however we did the bus and a taxi (sort of hard to find the street, so worth either doing the arranged transport or the taxi). It's down a little alley and you just ring the bell. Rooms were big and the bathroom was large, showers were stand up, but roomy enough. Stocked fridge in room. We were on the very top floor and had the terrace overlooking all the roofs which really felt like Italy! We took our breakfast up to the terrace every morning and it was wonderful to sit there, relax and plan your day. Also great at night for a drink or appetizers. I think it was room 41, but not sure. The terrace was worth it, and a fair price. Great location- we walked to everything -- especially to Piazza Navona, Trevvi Fountain -- we also walked to The Vatican and Colesseum. Lots of stairs with no lift - fyi - didn't bother us - allowed us to have one more gelato :) Just wander the streets around the hotel (cool area and lively at night) and Piazza Navona - it's heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Rome as it should be!”
Reviews.Author: Steffi40
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Residenza ai Coronari and are looking to return within the next couple of months! The occasion was my 40th birthday and I could not have had a better time anywhere. What a wonderful little gem this pensione is in the heart of Rome! Every sight is within walking distance (Pantheon, Trevi, Vatican, Spanish Steps, etc.) as well as being in such a pretty part of the city. Piazza Navona is great for watching the world go by accompanied by a drink and snack. The staff at the Residenza were very friendly and helpful and on a couple of occasions recommended very good restaurants close to the hotel. The food was delicious and the variety great. We even took back half a kilo of prosciutto from the local supermarket. Fabulous place! Highly recommend it. I noticed a lot of people complaining about the stairs in the hotel but we found the very manageable. We are already looking forward to returning to Rome and to the Residenza ai Coronari.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well-run, comfortable, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Toonces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights in Room 42, a double with private terrace, for 235 Euros/night (cash rate 215/Euros). This was our second stay at this small hotel (ten rooms) and again we had a great experience. Room 42 consists of one average-sized king bedroom, a modern, pretty bath, and a surprisingly large terrace (about 10X12 feet, estimate) with a table, two chairs and potted plants along the ledge. Can't say the view from the terrace was attractive (residential rooftops), but we had our own private, pleasant happy hours there with wine, bread and olives purchased at a wonderful little grocery steps down the Via Coronari. There is a small refrigerator in the room. Residenza Canali is located along the Via Coronari, a quiet, pretty, historic street of antique shops less than one block from (and pleasantly removed from) the noisy Piazza Navona. This is a lovely, safe area in Rome. One can walk to the Pantheon in less than five minutes, Castel San Angelo in ten, the Vatican in twenty minutes. The buses along Via Zanardelli, a block away, take you to the Forum, the Coloseum, Termini, etc. in just minutes You can purchase multi-day bus/metro passes at the tobacco shop at the corner of V. Coronari and V. Zanardelli . (FYI, a bus inspector checked passengers' tickets on one of our trips, and I believe there is a hefty fine if one doesn't have a ticket). The front desk is staffed by the famous Stefano and Francesca, who are very professional and detail-oriented and have a can-do attitude. They will help you with any need, but the rooms are so comfortable and thoughtfully provisioned, you will likely not need anything other than recommendations for restaurants and such. Cleanliness, nice fabrics, unobtrusive maid service, a lovely breakfast, great location, free internet computer in the lobby, no noise from other rooms, no odors, and proximity to good restaurants made this a perfect choice for us. The hotel has an arrangement with a private limo service to transport you to the airport, no matter how early, for 40 Euros (or 50, can't remember which)...we had a very pleasant young man as our driver. As for negatives, the stairs and the small shower are all I can think of. There is a wonderful family-owned small restaurant next door to the hotel, the Ristorante Tre Archi di Loneti. Mr. Loneti is the owner and server. We ate three dinners there (and had on our previous trip to Rome also). The eggplant parmigiana and spinach were wonderful; I looked forward to them all day!
