The house wine is very good and all prices are reasonable...probably about 45 Euros for two dinners with wine/beer. If you are looking for a quiet, comfortable, centrally-located small B&B, this is a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place next to Piazza Navona”
Reviews.Author: nikki-amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Nice little place with personal feel to it. Clean and refurbished rooms with character. Very central but in a nice and laid back area, just 500 meters from Piazza Navona.

Reviews.Title: “5 amazing days in rome !”
Reviews.Author: Ns_Zs
Reviews.Content: I decided 2 surprise my new husbend 4 his birthday and take him 2 a 5 day trip in romantic rome. Since he is useally the plan-maker between the 2 of us, i was a bit afraid to orgnize it all by myself, but thanks to "tripadvisor" it was much easier... i chose the "residenza canali" especially because of it's location - in the haert of rome, a minute from "piazza navona". it was importent for me that these 5 days will not waste because of travelling by bus and trains. lucky me, when i contected Francessca by mail, she offerd us the junior suite for my husbend's b-day and for a very reasonble price (90 euro per night in cash). we were abseloutly not dissapointed when we got 2 the hotel. it's a small cute hotel in walking distence from everywhere in rome ! (vatican - 15 min', piazza venezia- 30 min', fontana di trevi-15 min'...) if you don't want to walk, a lot of bus stations on the main street (zenadrelli i think). the staff at the hotel were very nice (especially steffano) though a little bit unhelpfull with advises about transportation (i think they just walk most of the time) but it wasn't hard to mannage by ourselvs. our romm was lovely - big and well decorated, and though we had 2 clime 3 stories everytime - we didn't care (we needed the good shape anyway so we can go around rome by foot). the breakfast is very good also if it's important for you (no vegtebals by the way). all and all, we had a gr8 time in rome, loved the "residenza canali" and will come back, we hope, with our kids... :) p.s. - the location of the hotel gave us the opretunity to come back at noon, rest a bit and go out again afternoon. and another tip - around piazza navona is a gr8 area to dring, eat and mix with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Two Single Women in Roma!!! You can't go wrong!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYPR
Reviews.Content: Booked our reservation on www.booking.com for 90 euros a night including a nice continental breakfast, asked them to make you a cappuccino and they will, but we found two of the best cappuccino places in Rome, will post later on. My girlfriend and I had a fabulous time. The only thing we did not like was that their internet service wasn't working and it was a bit costly to use the internet cafe a few blocks away. We were in Room #6 which had two small twin beds, tub and shower, which was nice since my friend enjoyed soaking in the tub after walking all day. It also had a coffee pot and a small basket filled with coffee and teas, and if you run out, just ask the front desk and they will give you more - all free of charge. They will supply you with iron and ironing board if you need one. and do not bring your own hair dryer as they will lend you one too. However, we found this great hair salon down the block "Marco Fava" and they have great prices so we had our hair done there three times. Ask for Mimmo, he's the best!!! I will post the pictures by the end of the week. Ciao Bella

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: steelpa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residenza Canali and it was a perfect place to stay for location. It was within walking distance to all sights and has the best Gelato in the area. Our favorite Gelato was not across the street in the coffee shop but a few streets away. Sorry, cannot remember the name. The room that we had was small but very clean and comfortable and we liked that we had access to the computer. The breakfast was the best that we had while in Italy for 12 days. The coffee was a little too strong though. I didn't feel that the young woman who was at the desk was very welcoming once we arrived. Don't get me wrong, everyone was nice and I am not sure we ever met the owners?? The young man who was at the desk in the early evening was extremly nice and helpful. I highly recommend this B and B and paying extra for a nice place, a great location, and a lovely breakfast was well worth the price. I also will recommend to get the Roma pass for using the buses around the city. Walking all day can get tiresome. We didn't need the HOHO bus at all. Everything is within walking distance of this B and B.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residenza Cenali ai Coronari”
Reviews.Author: curtisam
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best locations and hotels in all of Rome! We orginially wanted to stay close to the Trevi Fountain and am so glad that we didn't. It is very croweded by the Trevi Fountain which made it lose some of the beauty. Anyways, this hotel is close to Piazza Navona, just three or four blocks away, where there are lots of artists, music, fountains, and resaurants. The hotel was very clean and the staff was outstanding. Contact the hotel directly and you will probably get a better rate. Also, if you can pay cash, you will get an even better rate. I think we paid 150 euro per night, cash, for a double. I know one place that had an 800 number wanted to charge us 220 euro for the same place and same size room. Be careful how you book. We would go back and stay there again. Pleasant, romantic, convienent, and a good price, what more could you want?! By the way, be careful at restaurants. We didn't get charged to sit down to eat, however, we kept getting charged for bread that we never ordered. At one place we were charged 5 euros a piece for this small basket of bread. That was 20 euros for 4 of us. We later found out that they charge for the bread as a cover charge because you are sitting down at a table. We tried to tell them that we didn't want bread once, to take it away, and we were told we had to take it if we wanted to sit down and eat. Also, if you order fish, make sure what you are paying for. At one place we thought we were paying 8 euros for sea bass and were paying 8 euros PER GRAM! Ended up eating a forty dollar piece of fish. For the most part, most restaurants were less expensive than we had anticipated. Well, you will not be disappointed if you stay at this hotel. The pictures really don't do it justice. Four of us travelled together and we were all pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Brava Residenza Canali!”
Reviews.Author: LucieVB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, in our late 50s, just spent 4 nights at the RC, on our 5th visit to Bella Roma...and I am certain that I will dream about this place for years to come. We had only reserved 3 nights, but we so fell in love with both the Residenza (and Roma, again!), that we added a 4th night. We were given a room on the top floor, with a terrace looking out over the rooftops of beautiful Centro Storico. When we arrived in our room, we both felt like kids in a dream: it is truly a magical view from the spacious terrace outside Room#1. The location of the hotel is also perfect...right in the heart of one of the most beautiful, most walkable, most elegant-without-being-ostentatious parts of Rome. Though we bought a 3-day bus pass, we walked everywhere, including St. Peter's at night, Trastevere, Spanish Steps, and the Colisseum. We also had to climb 3 flights of stairs to reach our room -- there is no elevator, which might be a problem for some, but which we welcome as a way to justify our extra gelatos at the nearby plethora of gelateria!

Reviews.Title: “Great retreat from sightseeing in HOT Rome!”
Reviews.Author: reb347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Canali for 3 nights in August, and our stay was all I was hoping for and more! We had only reserved a regular room, but were pleasantly surprised at arrival that we had been given a room with a terrace (room # 2). I think the hotel (and all of Rome!) were quite while we were there due to the big summer holiday on August 15th. Stefano was wonderful and greeted us at the door at our arrival, and helped us with our luggage up the stairs. As others have mentioned, there is no elevator, but we had no problem managing our luggage, especially with the help of Stefano! Room #2 was wonderful!!!! It was the best air conditioning that we felt during our entire trip, and it was definitely needed because Rome was HOT while we were there. The room was bigger than expected with a closet area where we stored our suitcases and a bathroom large enough for both of us to get ready for the evening in there at the same time. The shower is a bit small, but again, we expected this, and it was larger than others we encountered on the same trip. Plus the shower pressure was great! Now for the best part about the room, the terrace! The terrace was large with a little table and 2 chairs, and each night of our stay we enjoyed a glass or 2 of wine (bought at the local grocery store) either before or after heading out for the evening. It was great to have some outdoor space to sit and enjoy a glass of wine, without having to pay to do it at a restaurant. Breakfast was a typical Italian breakfast with croissants, meats, cheeses, etc. But there were also cereals and fresh fruit, and my husband and I were both able to find plenty to eat at breakfast. The last thing I want to mention is the location, it was perfect! We walked everywhere, never had to take public transportation, and the walk was never too far. I think ancient Rome was the furthest, and that was probably only a 20 minute walk. Plus Piazza Navona was right around the corner which provided tons of dining options, and a nice place to stroll at night. I highly recommend the Residenza Canali. Hopefully we will return to Rome again at some point, and if so, we look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EltonKometa
Reviews.Content: i been in this wonderful hotel in the mounth of july with my girlfriend,and the place was amazing,the staff was very helpful and always with smile,the people give us the suite with the balcony and i past my best romantic moment of my life!the breakfast was so delicious and special.the next time that i come back in rome for sure i come to stay here Elton

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Canali ai Coronari”
Reviews.Author: tikcuf
Reviews.Content: Residenza Canali is a small hotel located on a relatively quiet side street in the heart of Rome. The hotel is within walking distance of virtually every major attraction in Rome, such as the Vatican, Forum, Coliseum, etc. There are also myriad restaurants and shops in this relatively upscale neighborhood. There is a taxi stand less than a block away and major bus routes within a few blocks, as well. The public areas of the hotel as well as the rooms have a considerable amount of charm. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained. There is a computer in the lobby for guest use. The hotel is air-conditioned and non-smoking. The staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly, and most speak English with a reasonable degree of fluency. They gladly made reservations for many of our planned activities, as well as some of our transportation within Rome without complaint (or charge). The atmosphere is very laid-back and appeared welcoming to guests of all ages. The bedrooms are a bit on the small side, but adequate and nicely appointed. The bathrooms are very nice. Our two rooms had showers and bidets, but not bathtubs. Noise from adjoining rooms is minimal. Breakfasts are very good. I highly recommend this hotel. If you are looking for a user-friendly, charming small hotel in central Rome, this hotel is a worthy choice.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: TorysLanding
Reviews.Content: When it comes a hotel, much depends on the location, your specific room, and the temperament of the staff. With budget hotels, a lot also depends on your expectations. We were very pleasantly surprised by the Canali, esp. having come by way of Sabaudia (4 star) and Montalcino (3 star). Location: It really is a fabulous location, maybe 50 meters to Piazza Navona but on a relatively quiet and pretty side street. If able bodied, one can walk anywhere from here, even our teenaged girls happily trooped along to the Colosseo and back on a very hot summer day. Rooms: We stayed five nights in three different rooms. Room 6 is great, two twin beds, pretty spacious, relatively bright (overall the hotel is a bit dim, but then all the shutters had to stay closed due to the very hot weather), perfect for the girls. My husband and I spent 4 nights in Room 1 on the top floor with a private terrace. This was a real bonus for us as the four of us were able to enjoy salumi and wine/water every night for dinner followed by a killer card game. Room 1 was again pretty spacious and fully appointed. The bathroom was modern and clean and while shower reminded me of the scene in Spinal Tap where the bassist gets stuck in a pod on stage, it was just fine and the water pressure was great. For some reason which we cannot explain, we were moved on our last night to Room D, described by several others below. Again, a great room for two, though a little dim for my taste. I think this room would be a little cramped if you had three people in it (one using the twin in the entry room). Decor: Traditional, perhaps a bit dated but not tacky. Cleanliness: Our three rooms were pretty spotless. Air conditioner: Fabulous in Room 1 (at the top of the building) and Room D, fine in Room 6. Staff: Extremely friendly, upbeat, and helpful. They were great. Breakfast: Pretty decent selection, small but nice common room. They do their best to cater to different tastes. Fruit, boxed cereals, yogurt, sliced meats and cheeses, pumpernickel, pastries, croissants, etc.. I didn't like the coffee but it's an easy amble and more fun anyways to visit a local bar. We would return to the Canali, esp. for the price which we thought was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Best location...great stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from an incredible trip to Rome. Residenza Canali was an excellent choice found after much research on TA. The B&B was perfect in everyway. The staff went above and beyond to accomodate our needs and the room was clean, roomy and bathroom was excellent. The breakfast was good with a wide variety of items. But mostly the location was the best! You could walk everywhere you needed to go and the area always seemed safe. If a place was too far to walk transportation was close by too! Overall, I would absolutely recommend the Residenza Canali and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: w0rld2c
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 5-9 and thoroughly enjoyed it! We booked the top floor terrace room which was a hike up and down, but for us not a problem. The room was a good size for the 2 of us and we enjoyed our coffee out on the terrace each morning. The breakfast room is very nicely allocated and provided a bit more of a start on the day than I'd had at the hotel we stayed at in Paris that only offered croissants. Here we had juices, milk, fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, and a meat/cheese selection. The coffee was good too. Steps away from the Piazza Navona and tons of other sites. We walked everywhere from the hotel. Best coffee: Piazza Sant Eustachio Il Caffe (pay at till then take ticket to counter and drink there) Best Gelato: San Crispino (found it while walking from Spanish Steps to the Trevi fountain) 2 excellent restaurants: one in the Piazza S.Ignazio, the other in Piazza S. Maria in Trastevere called "Ristorante Galeassi". Excellent food, service, and ambiance!! Best spa: El Spa (word of advice...europeans are more open than little Canadian girls : P The Hammam they offer was excellent and I got over being shy very quickly) We did 3 walking tours with the company "Through Eternity" and found them very informative. One word of advice from our tour guide on the Rome at Twilight tour...when in Rome and crossing the street "just close your eyes and go"...very fitting as Rome drivers are CRAZY!! We have been to cities in France, Turkey, and Greece in our travels and Rome drivers are insane. Just cross street and make eye contact with the drivers. If you slow down they'll speed up to get around you! I loved every moment in Italy and would stay at this hotel again..and yes, I am recommending it to friends who are travelling there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice B&B in an Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: PurpleNeon
Reviews.Content: If it was possible to assign 3 1/2 "stars" that is probably what I would have chosen. I think this was better than 3 but not quite four. We stayed here for 2 nights each at the beginning and end of our trip in May 2008. Agree with everyone on the following - - wonderful wonderful location - a block off of Piazza Navona, a quick walk to the Vatican, easy access to Trevi/Pantheon etc - the street (Coronari) is chock full of interesting shops - antiques, jewelrey, posters/paintings, awsome coffee bars and a few decent restaurants - the street is marked "area pedonale" (supposed to be pedestrian only) - ha! many mopeds, cars and even trucks totally ignore this! - once inside the stairs are steep - the hosts were more than accomodating with offering to haul our luggage up for us - we declined as we were fine but know that they are willing - breakfast was quite fine - I liked the addition of protein (there was always a meat and cheese tray out) and my husband enjoyed the cakes/tarts - agree with the person who commented on the lack of cappucino/espresso - however we found a number of fabulous coffee bars on via Coronari and who can complain about 2E worth of coffee (0.90 for husband's espresso and 1.10E for my cappuccino - I just about cried when I think about what the same order costs us at Starbucks!) On our first stay we had room 3 - it is very small but was perfectly fine for us as we were essentially just sleeping there - we slept with the window open but there is lots and lots of street noise - unbelieveably noisy pedestrians until the wee hours of the morning, and then the seagulls start! - we're not overly fussy sleepers so while irritating and enough to cause us to wake up every few hours it wasn't life altering - could be for fussy sleepers though - the bathroom was a bit dated and was not spotless, in my opinion - it was definitely surface clean and nothing horrific but I'm fussy and when my eyes wandered to corners of the floor or the edge of the shower, it just wasn't spotless - my husband, who is not fussy, didn't notice and didn't care - it wasn't enough to ruin anything but it was just there - this was a small shower room but this being our third trip to Europe staying in similar class hotels this has ceased to faze us - while perfectly adequate this was not my favourite room of the trip however, all of the other things (LOCATION!!! and being on such an awesome street and everyone being quite friendly) overcame this issue in my opinion On our return we were assigned Room D: - what a difference! This room (as described in a previous review) had an anteroom with a single bed and a bedroom with a larger bed - the bathroom was much larger with a tub shower! (after 16 days this was enough for a dance of joy - the space!) - this bathroom was much more modern than room 3 and this time was definitely spotlessly clean (I hate the subliminal impulse that starts my eyes wandering where maybe you just don't need to see things, you know?? :) ) - as the previous poster mentioned, we also slept with all of the windows closed except the bathroom to allow for air flow and this worked just fine - during the day with the windows open the street noise was quite loud (I can't even imagine what hotels on main streets must be like if this was an "area pedonale"!) - we didn't wake up at all with this arrangement - I liked this room much much better and this improved my overall outlook of this hotel - that's the rub with B&Bs/Palazzo's/Residenza's (in my opinion), they are lovely, authentic, quaint and not a generic Sheraton or Westin and a great way to meet other people but not all the rooms are the same and it can sometimes make or break your experience! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend staying here. If we return to Rome, I think I would still research other options (I'm not convinced this was the "one" for me) but I probably wouldn't try too hard if nothing was immediately apparant in this kind of price range.

Reviews.Title: “Consider the Canali”
Reviews.Author: parkhill24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in two rooms in the 10-room Residenza Canali ai Coronari for 11 nights in late April and early May, so we feel well-qualfied to comment. All considered, we were satisfied with our choice. The small staff makes a real difference. They are eager to meet any need or answer any question -- notably Stefano, star receptionist and, in our experience, the heart of the hotel...er, bed-and-breakfast. Our first room, Room C, was for three nights. It was on the third floor -- second floor in European terms. It had a tiny anteroom, tiny bedroom, tiny bathroom and shower and one large window, on Via Coronari. Note well: Via Coronari is touted as a "pedestrian" street, but it has light car and Vespa (moped) traffic day and night. You will hear that, as well as the loud conversations of passersby, if you are a light sleeper. Fortunately, it was cool enough to close the window at night and be comfortable. Closed, the windows block out noise well. There is air-conditioning and heating, but neither was in season in the time we stayed. Then we were moved to Room D across the hall. It had a larger anteroom, larger bedroom, larger bathroom. Best of all, the bathroom window could be left open at night, allowing the bedroom and anteroom windows to be closed. Bliss. Slept right through. The shower was in the bathtub, and worked great. In fact, the Canali's modern bathrooms get an "A" from us for cleanliness and function. The breakfast room was small and just adequately lighted, but the breakfast itself was good enough to satisfy us for the entire stay without getting bored. A decent selection and quite fresh. We found that most other guests during our stay were foreign -- English, Dutch, French, etc. -- with only a few Americans. The Canali is not in any sense a luxury hotel. It is a bed-and-breakfast -- not usually our cup of tea. Its steps are steep, its decor dated except for the bathrooms. But it is warmly friendly, spotlessly maintained and perfectly located -- not a bad trifecta. Any doubts we had on check-in had vanished long before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but a bit too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Michal32
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 4 days at RC. Pensione is small and does not have too much to offer. The shower is very small, hairdryer is weak and it used to turn on without any reason – we kept the cable out of the power socket. But generally the bathroom was nice and kept clean with everyday fresh towels and soap. Rooms tidy but there was big closet in the corridor – for 4 days it was just enough. The staff is OK, but I tried to use PC – the monitor was broken and someone was supposed to take care of it next day, and next day… someone is to… So I visited Internet café regularly. There are narrow stairs to the first floor where reception is - so do not recommend for people with disabilities. I do also advise to order the shuttle from the airport – hotel offers it for €45 which is quite reasonable - taxi costs pretty the same but when you are first time in Rome Residenza is not easy to find RC. Breakfast – I got used to solid ones, but although there is quite limited choice I was satisfied – specially with cheese, ham and bread/rolls quality. So it was Ok to start the day. But do not expect crispy bacon or eggs, etc. So taking all of that into consideration €180/night (while paying a cash) is quite expensive. Now the best part. It’s perfectly located. One minute from Piazza Navona, 15’ from Vatican and Fontana di Trevi or Spanish Steps, 20-25’ from Forum Romanum, etc… You will find a lot of fine night life close to Piazza Navona (if you are more pub fun enter PN and turn right in the middle the go into net of small streets – you will find nice pubs, some with live music) or Pantheon. We ate close to the last one at Hostaria – small but with very friendly owner – they served excellent ravioli with mushroom dressing. So what you really pay for is a piece of rather hard mattress in the real heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Can walk to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: PickyTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this B&B for 3 nights. It is very conveniently located and we could walk everywhere. The only time we didn't walk was when we were tired and wanted to go to Trastevere one evening. Breakfast is adequate..usual sort of breakfast - cereal/croissant/cheese/juice. Staff were semi friendly. The rooms are small like everywhere in Europe. There is heating. The only downside is that there are stairs to climb to reach reception and the rooms, so if you have heavy luggage or have difficulty climbing then this probably isn't the best place for you. We had travelled from quite far and had asked for a pick up from the airport. I would definitely recommend this because on our own we would have found it tiresome after a long flght and difficult to find the B&B on our own since it is located in a small alley. The driver that picks you up in his mercedes doesn't know much English so knowing some Italian is useful! We had a fine and comfortable stay there. Thought that 180 Euros cash was a bit pricey but then realised that for the location that's the price you have to pay in places like Rome/Venice. Would recommend it if you are ok with stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and more...”
Reviews.Author: Mrpilgrim2u
Reviews.Content: As has been said this is a sweet almost hidden place on a cobble stone road in a wonderful location of incredible Rome. The staff is very helpful and the building has an old world yet upscale apartment feel. The room for breakfast is set beautifully everyday with matching china, fresh flowers and the selections changed every day with great detail to cold juices appealing looking service and fresh foods. Something new every day of our four night stay. Our room with a window out to the street was small but comfortable and it was not a noisy street. This hotel has many stairs and is not for the handicapped. This room had the smallest shower I have ever seen. There needs to be a weight limit for this room or you would never move around at all in this shower. This place is great but there are some things that need attention or that was a little puzzling to us for the money. The drains are so slow you are standing in your shower water and must get out at the top or it will spill over. Same with the sink. They have beautiful bathrooms but time to clean some drains also you don't hear the street but you can hear others get up use their hair dryers etc. and we became so used to having someone make great cappuccinos or espresso in all the other places we stayed that the availability of just coffee from a self serve container was a little disappointing but still high marks for breakfast. There was one other thing that was strange. You have a small honor bar in your room but we did not have anyone tell us that the beverages and snacks that are there upon arrival are yours and included in the room price. We only discovered this when we asked for the price list to the honor bar selection and was told of the extra treats. Perhaps it was just an error at check in but let it be known enjoy your treats! I am sure there was more to enjoy but Rome was just out the front door and 4 nights was simply not enough. Down the street to the right as you leave the front door and come out to the main little street down past the antique shops on the left was a great wine bar/restaurant and down farther on the left was a great hand made gelato shop also across from the great wine bar that offers a nice appetizer hour just across the way from them is another restaurant on the other side of the water fountain where I received the ground zero worst risotto I have ever had in my life and I have now made it a shrine to what the worst can be but there is so much around that area and , well , as always we had a great time and this hotel added to our experience !

Reviews.Title: “Very kind, great location”
Reviews.Author: canziano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel only one night, but it was enough to appreciate the very friendly and kind staff. We went for breakfast too late, but the guy was very kind and prepared everything in a few minutes for us. Room was very nice, spotless and spacious. Absolutely quiet by night. Excellent location, just a few steps from piazza Navona. I would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: flosssy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this upmarket bed and breakfast in Rome. The location is truly excellent. Whilst some of the reviews exaggerate a little (2 seconds?) it is literally a minute's walk from Piazza Navona, 5 minutes walk from the Pantheon, 10 minutes to the middle of St Peter's Square. The hotel itself is just off a very picturesque cobbled street and you do feel like you're in the heart of the Centro Storico. We had booked four rooms for five people in total. When we arrived, there was a mix up with the booking and one of the rooms was a double rather than a twin. Aside from that, the hotel was very pleasant indeed. It is extremely clean, the bathrooms are modern and comfortable. The bedrooms vary from spacious to compact, but all are decorated in traditional style and are newly refurbished. All rooms have a safe and had tea/coffee making facilities which was an unexpected bonus. My room had a terrace with table and chairs but with a very limited view of rooftops. The breakfast is typically Italian (breads, cheeses, cold meats, yoghurt, cereals, cake, fruit, orange juice and tea/coffee) but of excellent quality and plentiful. We found the staff to be incredibly polite and helpful, with most speaking very good English. One minor downside is the lack of an elevator - my room was at the top of four flights of stairs! This aside, I have stayed in some of the best rated hotels and residences in Rome (Villa San Pio, Appartments Michelangelo) and this is the one I would return to - the location wins out and the accommodation equals them. Don't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: marie97
Reviews.Content: We book the Hotel with a fantastic agency based in Italy, that has organized our trip to Rome. We are French and never been to Italy, this is was our first trip, and our agency, www.senseofitaly.com organized for us a trip that was jus a dream... we spend a couple of nights at the hotel and we really enjoied... Marie & Pierre

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Melb_cathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised. Perhaps the best part of the Residenza Canali is the location. The place was set down a beautiful cobbled street which had mainly cute antique stores. We walked EVERYWHERE - Colosseo, The Vatican, Trevi Foutain...and the Pantheon and Navona Square are practically 2 seconds away! We were surprised at how walkable Rome was. The rooms were nicely decorated and included great amenities (selection of coffee/tea, kettle, toiletries, hairdryer etc) My only gripe was that when we arrived we were placed in the suite (which we weren't told so we just thought the rooms in this place were massive). But when we returned from dinner that day they told us that we had to move in the morning to a normal room....Now it was nice to stay in the suite (which was fab in terms of the space) but it was a bit of a hassle to repack everything so they could move us... Despite that incident (and it is really a small thing) everything at the Residenza Canali was great (including the breakfast). The staff were super friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: DandR6086
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at Residenza Canali in early October. The location around the corner from Piazza Navona was very convenient. Our room at this small European-style hotel was clean and very comfortable, although not as nice as our other friends' staying in the same hotel. By the time we'd come back from hours and hours of walking Rome it was a welcome retreat and all we needed. The city is noisy and vibrant into the late hours but in closing double pane windows there was no outdoor noise at all. Special thanks to Stefano at the front desk. When our son, who is studying in Rome, lost his cell phone Stefano spent quite a bit of time helping us get things straightened out with the Italian cell phone company. He was always gracious and cheerful. Thank you, Stefano!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGirl_in_Aussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in October after staying near Termini for three nights also. IMO as a single female I would not recommend the Termini area. Once I moved to the Canali my whole impression of Rome changed for the better. The Canali is located right behind Piazza Navona but on a quiet street. The room I stayed in had its own terrace which was large enough to walk around on as well as having a table and chairs. It was great being able to hang wet clothes out there and they would dry easily. The room was lovely and well equipped with all the essentials. TV even had some English news channels. Breakfast was nice although the breakfast area is cozy to say the best! Reception was mainly friendly and helpful although a little reserved. Probably I was not their typicaly guest as the B&B did seem to cater mostly for couples. They did seem suprised I had no partner in tow! All in all I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. I thought the room was an excellent size and very prettily decorated. On location alone I wouldn't be looking anywhere else next time I go to Rome. Hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in all of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiebookchick
Reviews.Content: Residenza Canali is perfectly situated, off of the prettiest street in Rome, Via Coronari. Being Rome, there is street noise, so make sure to close the windows and use the air-conditioner. We loved having easy access to all the major sights of historic Rome, plus the romantic ambience of the narrow cobble-stoned streets around Piazza Navona. Breakfast is lovely and generous.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: travelsteveKc
Reviews.Content: Afraid to say how great it was since next time I want to go there it will be all booked up. Except for the stairs it couldn't have been better. Staff was OUTSTANDING, and location great.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,location”
Reviews.Author: Kezarkid
Reviews.Content: This hotel served our purpose. We wanted to be by the Piazza Navona area and it is 122 steps from the front door to the Piazza. The rooms are adequate. We had asked for a Terrace room and on arrival it was not available. We were told that someone had been in the room and they were leaving the next day. We asked for it and they obliged. we were in Room 1. A big terrace. No complaints about room size, bed or bathroom. No complaints about anything. Breakfast is included in price and it was very good with good selection. We went over to the Piazza every night and even when it was noisy there when we got back to the room you couldn't hear anything. Via dei Coronari is a very nice street with many quality shops and restaurants. The staff was very helpful. They got us reservations at Borghese Gallery and arranged taxi ride to airport at early morning hour. Very helpful. I had bought a big bottle to fill with water and used the water dispenser in the breakfast room before I left for our travels around the city. They even accommodated my request for adding ice to the water bottle. I am 66 years old but in excellent shape. We walked all over Rome and the 5 flights up to room 1 was no problem. If you aren't in good shape though, I wouldn't recommend the Terrace rooms. We paid in cash and saved about 22 euros a night. A suggestion if you are taking a taxi to the hotel. Direct driver to 231 Via dei Coronari and hotel is right there. When I asked our driver to take us to 13 Tre Archi he had to go to his info book and try to figure where it was.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: NSF1978
Reviews.Content: I visited Residenza Canali on August and September of this year during my honeymoon and I had a great experience. My first good impresion was when I wrote an email to the Residenza asking for some booking information and I recieved a kindly and fast answer from our host Stephano. This was my fifth time in Rome and I have to say that the location, service, breakfast and room were excellent. If I have to mention any complain I just have to say that probably the only problem was the size of the shower, because we didn't have a bathtub and the stairs, but since we are a young couple, the stairs wasn't a problem for us. I really recommend this charming roman hotel and I surely will come back. I have to thanks Stephano and all the staff for their kindly service and good restaurants recommendations. If you wan't an advice, go for the junior suite with terrace, it view is unforgettable...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Aussies1
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome with our 3 teenage children. We had two interconnecting rooms, the kids room was very small and the beds not particularly comfortable. I would probably recommend with a family our size getting two separate rooms with a bathroom each. The hotel was small with no lift but in a fabulous location. There was no street noise at all. We felt very safe here and the little cobbled street was full of antique shops and surrounded by great restaurants. We were able to walk everywhere easily. Breakfast was quite nice and the hotel service was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: firemanlover
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled to get to tell you about our exceptional experience at the Residenza di Canali. First I will share that you cannot find a better, more informed, more attentive, more charming, happy, service and guest oriented staff! Stefano, a true celebrity from all the feedback on the internet, is a kind and old fashioned helpful inn keeper. He helped us with EVERYTHING and truly our stay in Rome would have been a catastrophe without his assistance (we encountered some real travel challenges as we arrived in Rome.) The place is immaculate! Room are not huge but always clean. We had a GREAT bathroom and a terrace (if you cannot climb 5 flights of stairs after a day of touring Rome, DON'T ask for the terrace room!) which looked out on the neighborhood rooftops. The intimacy of this beautiful villa is captivating. The food was great! Only drawback was our room was extremely hot. The AC was NOT good (they gave us a fan) but we opened the french doors to the terrace and pulled the bed over to the fresh air where we could watch the beautiful Roman sky. What you get at this small hotel is well priced and honestly, when Stefano walked us out to our waiting taxi as we said arrivedercii for the last time, I truly felt like I was leaving a friend. STEFANO, YOU ARE A STAR not just on Tripadvisor but in our hearts!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: StuttgartHausfrau
Reviews.Content: My mother and I spent 4 nights at Residenza Canali in June. I was a little nervous, having read a few complaints about the service (particularly with regard to female guests), but we were extremely pleased with our experience. If you want a large, elegant hotel with lots of fuss and glamour, the Canali isn't for you. But if you are looking for a small, personal hotel where you are greeted with a smile and can enjoy a nice breakfast before setting out to explore Rome, this is the place. All the staff were very friendly and we enjoyed chatting with them. We didn't have any special requests or needs aside from arranging our airport transportation, which went very smoothly. The hotel is in a gorgeous 18th-century villa just off of the lovely Via dei Coronari. We couldn't believe how close we were to Piazza Navona (which was very helpful when we ran out of money one night!). The only thing marking the hotel is a tiny label next to the doorbell, which you must ring in order to enter. The reception desk, up one flight of stairs, is manned 24 hours a day. It made us feel like we were staying in our own private villa! Our twin room on the 4th floor was quite small and a bit dim, but it was very clean, with nice furnishings and fabrics, a window looking out over the street, a large wardrobe with room for our 2 suitcases, a dressing table, A/C and a lovely tile bathroom. Our only complaint was that we really needed a second mirror in the bedroom - we politely suggested this when we left. We also mentioned that my mother had not been assisted with her bag up the 3 flights of stairs when we arrived, and the staff apologized for this oversight. I have previously splurged for a Pantheon-view room at the Albergo del Senato, but for a reasonably-priced (we paid 185 Euro cash, which was a 20 Euro discount off the credit card price), high-quality room in the center of Rome, the Canali is an amazing find. I would definitely stay here again (and would try to get one of the top-floor rooms with private terrace!).

Reviews.Title: “A real keeper”
Reviews.Author: ronpet
Reviews.Content: We are trip advisor members from Pennsylvania in the USA. My wife, daughter and I had a junior suite. The Canali is centrally located with easy access to the main tourist sites. Clean, quiet and spacious rooms with a nice breakfast. The staff was very, very friendly and extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. This made some of our travels around Rome much easier. Because it was on a side street off of Piazza Navonna it was quiet and pleasant. The air conditioning was superb and needed in the hot July weather. This is a great place for parents to stay when visiting college students studying abroad who are staying at Campo de Fiori. We stayed 6 nights and would return again when we revisit Rome. You will not be disappointed. The candies at the registration desk are something to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeCheshire
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and three teenage children have just returned from a 4 night break in Rome, staying at this wonderful hotel. The airport pick up, which was arranged via email direct with the hotel, was an efficient way to get into the city and delivered us right to the reception area of the hotel by the driver who helped with bags etc. The childrens room was spacious enough and our room on the top floor was lovely. It had a great roof terrace which was a lovely place to sit on an evening after a busy day. The rooms were clean and tastefully decorated and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and loads of towels. Breakfast was more than adequate with plenty of choice and everything was very fresh. Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. All major sights in Rome are within walking distance of the hotel which made it the perfect location for us. It is right by the Piazza Navona so not far to walk for dinner on an evening! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a small family run hotel with lots of character in a central location. We would love to return to Rome and if we do we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice and great location”
Reviews.Author: TMLAalum
Reviews.Content: We were in Room 2 on the top floor. I specifically requested a room with a terrace and the only drawback to this room is that the A/C could not keep up with the extreme heat. I learned that the owner is planning on upgrading the A/C but until then be prepared to be very warm if you go in the summer. The terrace faces east so it is cooler and pleasant to sit on in the evening. Staff was extremely helpful and patient and their restaurant recommendations, especially the Trei Archi de Loretto, were excellent. I loved how the Residenza Canali is tucked away but yet so close to the Piazza Navona and an easy walk to the Pantheon and Vatican. The breakfast room has been relocated recently and is sunny and bright with a good choice of pastries and meats. I would happily return to this charming little inn on my next visit to Rome- which will NOT be in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: BarrieBarrie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the residenza Canali Mid July 2007. It is a very small quaint hotel with just a front reception and rooms upstairs. It seems small but the rooms are spacious. It is in the best location because it is close to everything. All things that you need to see are within walking distance. Palazzo Narvona is just at the end of the street and comes to life at night, so you are just a short walk back to your hotel. The bathrooms are filled with all the amenities and the rooms are clean and large for Europe. It is very lovely. The front reception staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: E.Clements
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome after staying at Residenza Canali for one week and can truthfully say it was wonderful. Hotel is in a great location, within 10 minutes walk in either direction for all the major sites. We had a top floor room with a terrace, which could have been a problem as there are no lifts but a big thank you to Stephan who carried our cases up for us. My husband and I were both celebrating our birthdays and our anniversary and we received a lovely big bunch of flowers and a card from Residenza Canali. All the staff were so helpful and friendly that I have no hesitation in recommending them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallish rooms”
Reviews.Author: adu16
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Italy in early June of 2007 for our honeymoon and started our tip here. It was my first trip to Europe, but based on my extensive reading on what to expect, this hotel seems better than average. As most people state, this hotel has a great location. We walked to the ancient ruins (Colisseum, Forum, etc.) and the Spanish Steps; we took a bus to the Vatican (only because we were tired). The hotel is very close to Piazza Navona, but I would recommend eating at one of the small restaurants on a side street. Osteria del Pegno and Osteria del Aquino were both excellent. American travellers should be prepared for the small hotel rooms and the dearth of English-speaking channels on TV (only two). While the room may be small, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was bigger than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: trvldoc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Residenza Canali. It has an "old world" feel and is spectacularly located. Some hotels of this type feel run down and shabby, but RC is not. Our beds were comfy, the bathroom was adequate for 4 persons, there was both a fridge and safe in the room, and the much-needed A/C worked well. Their breakfast was the best of our trip with delicious dark coffee, bakery items, fruit, and meat every morning. The only shabby part of the place is the terrace. They could do a lot to spruce that area up, like clean it. But we did not use the terrace that much b/c of the heat and the mosquitos. Many, many good restaurants within easy walking distance and of course the Piazza Novona is just a stone's throw away so you can stroll in the evening with your gelato or go browse around for that "genuine" Prada handbag for 10 euros. They have no elevator and no computer to print out boarding passes. There is a handy taxi stand 1 block away. Lastly, they have a driver service to the airport which we used. I found him impatient and he does not have enough seat belts for 4 people despite me asking specifically about this issue before we booked. I would not use him again. He charges the same as a taxi (actually 5 euros more) and unless you need his big trunk for lots of luggage I just do not see any advantage. Plenty of taxis have adequate seat belts for 4. Since I do not know where else to post a review of tours I will say one thing abaout tours here. We booked a day trip to Pompeii with Context Rome that was spectacular. I highly recommend them. Additionally, we used RomeWalks for 2 tours in Rome, one at the Vatican, one at the Forum. RomeWalks was very middle of the road and I would probably not use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: zorro10
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice, in one of the suites with a terrace. The rooms are large, and the terrace is a boon in the good weather. The location cannot be beaten - everything is within walking distance. There are good restaurants in the area, which the staff will recommend. All the staff are pleasant and helpful. I would not consider staying elsewhere when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: tmoniz
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip in Rome. We stayed at Residenza Canali for only two nights but would have loved to stay longer. The location is fabulous, about equidistance between the forum and the Vatican. Lots of great restaurants nearby. The hotel has a great feel to it and is clean and quiet. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NixM
Reviews.Content: The hotel is hidden away in a side street just off Piazza Navona. It is hard to find being in a pedestrianised area (in theory) and with only the description/sign a small card/name plate alongside the bell marking the front door. The room was pleasant but small with very limited storage space, two of us with weekend luggage was too much for the very small wardrobe with three coathangers and one shelf. We did have a problem with dirty bed linen from a previous guest but this was fixed swiftly by the staff when we complained. The bathroom was large and well decorated. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't hear any outside noise in the room but could hear adjoining bathrooms sufficiently that it woke us up everytime someone in a neighbouring room used the facilities, not ideal. Breakfast was pleasant with everything we needed. We used the hotel as a base exploring the local area and it was in an excellent location once you had found it. For the money we paid we expected more, I would go back but most probably try somewhere else first.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to start a trip!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoRoma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our 2 week trip here and we absolutely loved this hotel. We arrived on May 3rd, stayed in room #2 for 5 nights and loved it. I would recommend arranging the car service through the hotel. That's what we did and they obviously know right where the hotel is. It is very small and has about a 2 inch by 2 inch sign (which we thought was so cool). It's so conveniently located to just about everything. I couldn't have asked for a better location and Piazza Navona is always alive, so even if you don't feel like going very far there is something to do. The terrace (only in rooms 1 & 2) was great and adds so much to the room. It was great to sit out there and listen to Italian life go by. With the terrace doors closed it was a very quiet room, although we enjoyed taking naps with the door open as it let the breeze in. The bathroom was very big and clean, the bed comfortable and the mini bar stocked. The stairs were a great workout & only inconvenient at check in and check out, but worth it. I can't really comment on the breakfast as we were rarely up at breakfast time. Dang time difference was hard to get used to. I can say that Stefano was AWESOME! We spent lots of time talking to him and he was willing to help us with anything. Restaurant recommendations, help with the language, train schedules, anything. We loved seeing him at the desk when we came back from a long day of sightseeing. Not to say that the rest of the staff isn't great because they were all very friendly, I think Stefano is just there more often. My recommendation would be to actually stop and talk to Stefano for awhile instead of just grabbing your key and heading to your room, he's a great guy. We would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away but great access to Piazza Navona and ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: Denndy
Reviews.Content: We began our 2 weeks in Italy here, and after the climb to the second floor reception, we felt totally at home. Stefano helped with restaurant suggestions and directions and all the staff gladly responded to every request. My wife, a real foodie with a sweet tooth, felt their fresh pastries were the best we had for breakfast during our travels. Located around the corner from the Piazza Navona, we walked there down a wisteria covered lane, and often enjoyed a gelato in the afternoon on the way back. The neighborhood restaurant next store served reasonably-priced, excellent meals. You're in the heart of everything, but can return to this quiet oasis. At the end of a long day, the comfortable bed and gracious accommodations were most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Roveranos
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, lovely rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, convenient - not luxurious but nice”
Reviews.Author: Tomot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Canali ai Coronari for four nights in late March. Based on the TripAdvisor reviews, Residenza Canali appeared to fit my requirements for a clean, very quiet hotel less than 200 euro/night. I was very nervous, however, because both my partner and I are very sensitive to noise at night and the hotel is in a very central location; just around the corner from Piazza Novona. Also, even though most of the reviews said the hotel was quiet, there were a few people who mentioned they were bothered by noise--- if anyone was going to be bothered by noise, it would be us, so we emailed the hotel and requested a quiet room. We had the hotel arrange pick-up from the airport - very convenient and 45 euro (taking the train is also an option). We were given room #2 which was on the top floor. I was very pleasantly surprised w/ the room - the room was an average size for a room in Rome but the bathroom and balcony were large (i think only rooms 1 and 2 have balconies). Everything was very clean - this is not a 4 star hotel, so it is not super-luxurious but they are charging at least 100 euro a night less than a 4 star and I believe the trade off is well worth it. What we liked about the hotel: - Friendly staff. - Clean. - Quiet - at least our room was exceptionally quiet. - Convenient location. Things you may want to consider (none of these bothered us but they may be a problem for some) - There is no elevator and the stairs are a bit steep for someone who has problems walking (I enjoyed using the stairs but it is not for everyone) - The breakfast was fairly basic (though the same as other comparably priced hotels) and the breakfast room was a bit cramped. Again this was fine with us as there are many places to get espresso/pastries within a few blocks. - Our bathroom was very nicely done and modern; however, the shower (no tub) may be a bit confining for a larger person. Overall this was a very good hotel - it is not inexpensive but considering the rates in Rome, I think it was a good deal and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel”
Reviews.Author: Rijel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a six day stay in Rome. The Residenza Canale is a truly authentic palazzio hotel. Tucked away on a narrow side street (and therefore easy "not" to find, i suspect), it is set in a fantastic location for visiting the city. Seems to be just a stroll away from all the major sights (or is that "sites"?). Small and intimate, with really friendly staff who made great nearby eating recommendations. Of course, the building has steep stairs and no lift, so not good for disabled or infirm visitors. We also found the area quite noisy with passing voices late at night (we sleep with windows open) but so tired after our days walking that this was not an issue overall. Definitely an "excellent".

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: rocker1a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in Feb 2007 for 3 nights. We would reccommend the hotel arrange a taxi pick up for you as it is very tucked away. They send a good standard of private taxi. This is a small hotel on a side street near Piazza Navona. Although near it it feels miles away. There is barely a name outside the hotel but once inside you find a 24 hour reception, English speaking staff and a small but very clean en suite bedroom. Our room had a little balcony. Not much of a view but perfect if you are there in Summer for a seat outside. As mentioned previously there is no bar, lobby etc but if you want a quiet stay with no fuss it's perfect. Great breakfast to set you up for the day. Tea and coffee making in the bedroom. We walked miles during our stay but this hotel is equidistant to a lot of sites and it is possible to call in during the day and continue elsewhere. We felt no need for public tansport. It was no problem for us but the hotel has no lift so be prepared to climb stairs daily to you room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find in a safe location for the 'Over 60 Club'!”
Reviews.Author: nini74
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me apologise to TA members and Resi. Canali staff for the amount of time it has taken me to write this review!!! Secondly, I must explain that I am writing the review on behalf of my mum and her 2 friends (The Golden Girls)! Thirdly, yes I can take the credit for finding and booking such a fab little gem! My mum and her friends celebrated their 60th Birthdays with a 5 day treat in Rome. Residenza Canali made it even more special. I booked directly with Resi. Canali, I think the personal touch goes a long way. It's so difficult to choose a hotel, even more so when it's for someone else, so I often find a telephone call helps me decide. It was lovely to speak to Stefano who also kindly arranged a taxi pick-up, Euro 90 for 3 and their cases return Ciampino-Hotel-Ciampino. We had originally booked 2 twin rooms but a few days before departure a friend had to pull out because of an illness. I made a phonecall to Canali to explain my problem and they solved it without hesitation and with no extra charge. My mum changed to a single room, euro 115 when paid in cash. Euro 135 (cash) for the twin. So off they went! They had a fabulous time! The rooms were clean, warm and quiet. Breakfast met their expectations, the girls love their cakes and fruit! The stairs could have been a problem but they are all fairly fit. You need to appreciate that not all buildings in Rome have lifts. Besides, stairs are good for your health! Location - I had previously stayed in an apartment on Coronari so I knew the location would be safe for them and central. They walked everywhere. It really is an excellent price for such a prime location! The airport pick up was efficient and friendly. Mum said that all the staff were very kind and attentive. They even allowed my aunt to use the phone on the desk. No fancy hotel front, but remember, never judge a book by it's cover!! Don't hesitate, give them a ring if you're not sure. Thank you Residenza Canali Marie, Wendy and Di

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay In Rome”
Reviews.Author: betty13
Reviews.Content: This is the most wonderful option for staying in Rome. You get the feel of a beautiful Roman apartment with the care of a hotel. Besides the fact that it is beautiful, the staff is so friendly and helpful and the location is the absolute best in all of Rome. It is located in the Antiques district. Make a left out of the residenza and you are steps from Piazza Navona. Make a right and you have tiny cobblestone streets of authentic residential Rome with the best restaurants and gelaterias. I recommend staying in the top floor suite with the private terrace. It is much nicer than any 5 star hotel room and the price is unbeatable! The breakfast is amazing as well. Go to (---) and look up Residenza Canali ai Coronari for the best pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location..!!”
Reviews.Author: oreghe
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress enough how great the location of this little hotel is. It is situated off a pretty little antique street right around the corner from Navona square. Everything is within very easy walking distance - exactly what we wanted for our short stay in Rome. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room (no. 5) was huge, clean and comfortable with a really powerful shower! There were loads of great restaurants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT find”
Reviews.Author: VAGreg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night (Nov 15-19) stay at the Residenza Canali. One block from the Piazza Navona, this hotel was located 15 minutes from the Vatican, 15 minutes from the Colosseum (by bus) and in the heart of everything. The rooms were very clean and spacious -- yes spacious. The staff was very friendly. They offered great restaurant recommendations and were knowledgeable about much of the goings-on in Rome. I would return to this hotel again for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Cachia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just arrived from a 6 night stay at the Residenza Canali. This is our 6th holiday to Rome, but it was certainly the best, and a main reason for this was staying at this Jewel in the Heart of Rome. I don't know where to start...it's position is perfect, right in the centre of the Centro Storico, set on the most lovely and pedestrian street..Via Coronai. It was so quiet we just could not believe we were in Rome! The decor was done with such love for detail: polished wooden floors and ceilings, rooms and public areas furnished with antiques and rich curtains.The bed and cleanliness were excellent, with lovely brand new bathrooms with top notch fittings and towels and toiletries. The breakfast (buffet) was first -class, with cereals, various types of freshly baked bread, yoghurts, meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, real orange juice, and last but not least, the pastries! To die for! Everyday a different type of cake or torta with croissants and pastries just baked..hmmmmm! Beautiful breakfast room with lovely damask tablecloths, fresh flowers on each table. Tea and coffee making facilities in each room (top quality once again) Service always with a smile and always ready to help. I could go on but all I can say is go and see for yourself. You will feel you are really experiencing Antica Roma when staying in this exquisite jewel in the heart of Rome. Signora Canali and Staff, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexma90
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Residenza was very nice, but I wouldn't RAVE about the place; I'm sure there are other hotels in Rome at this price range that would work just as well. (We chose to pay in cash and got a discount.) The location was wonderful, of course, right by Piazza Navona, and I loved wandering up and down via Coronari, with all its antique shops. (But other hotels are equally centrally located.) And I already knew our room was on the top floor, with no elevator, so that wasn't an issue (we never use hotel elevators anyway). Stephano, at the front desk most evenings, was very kind and helpful, even more so than the other staff, who were all accommodating. Our room, #2 at the top, with a little terrace, was nice, though not as spacious as the pictures make it out to be. The terrace was a great feature, but we didn't use it as much as I thought we would, as we ended up preferring to sit and people-watch on Piazza Navona. (That's a comment on our preferences; for someone who likes terraces in their rooms, the room would be wonderful.) This was the only hotel we stayed at in Italy that had a hot water pot in the room for making tea, which was great. My biggest disappointment was in the breakfast, which many reviewers said was great. I found the food the same as at many places; I only ever have a cornetto and maybe some fruit, and there offerings in those departments were fine. The breakfast room itself was cramped and felt windowless (I can't remember if there were windows or not). But no cappucino! (Regular coffee, tea and juice were offered.) That really bothered me. After the first morning, we skipped breakfast at the hotel, and instead went to Bar Mariotto, just at the entrance to Piazza Navona. There, we could sit outside with a view onto Piazza Navona, with a delicious cup of cappucino (including a dusting of chocolate in the bottom of the cup prior to adding the espresso - very nice touch) and a cornetto for about 3.50 Euros total for two people. Bottom line, if you want a terrace and coffee or tea with breakfast, this place would be great. I would probably stay here again, despite the hotel's breakfast, because I'd rather have breakfast near Piazza Navona anyway. And as an aside, if you're a runner, this hotel has a GREAT location, because you can run, basically, straight down via Coronari and run along the river in either direction, or run across Ponte Sant'Angelo and around the Castel Sant'Angelo, or even to St. Peter's. Even for a directionally-challenged person like myself, I couldn't get lost.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: melman
Reviews.Content: We phoned this hotel to book a room for 3 nights and the staff were so helpful and friendly. They will also organise a car to collect you from the airport for a reasonable price. We were thrilled with our room which was on the very top floor with a terrace. As long as you don't mind stairs I would recommend this as the room was spacious and clean and just lovely. The Balcony overlooks the tiled rooffs of surrounding buildings but it feels so private and tranquil and a great way to start your day on the rooftops of rome with your tea or coffee. It is set on a quiet cobbled street in the antique district of rome and so doesn't feel noisy and touristy and yet a few minutes walk and you are at Piazza Navona - (fabulous to sit and people watch by the fountains at night) and a short walk to the Vaican as well. As it is centally located it is easy to get to all the well known sights as well. I would definitely stay here again as the whole experience was wonderful and we found them exceptionally well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Charand
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the positive reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. This is a delightful hotel. We stayed here with our three children in the family suite. The room (two adjoining) was great, airconditioned and location near piazza navone was unbeatable. Breakfasts were great. Yet, it was the Staff that really made this place fantastic. They were welcoming, (carried our luggage up the stairs), helpful in arranging cabs, tours and restaurants and and overall wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JumeirahJ
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a week in Rome where we stayed at this fantastic hotel. Like others have said - the location is amazing. Piazza Navona is metres away so no shortage of restaurants and people watching opportunities. We walked everywhere (with 10 & 11 yr old kids in tow) and used the hotel for popping back to as it was so convenient. We had both rooms on the top floor with the fab terraces. Well worth the hike up the 89 steps (the kids counted!)

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed stay at Residenza Canali”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscofivetogo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2+week trip in Italy, and I have to take a moment to thank our hosts at Residenza Canali. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We traveled with our 3 kids 14,11,8 and were in the top room with the terrace. Although it was very HOT in Rome during our stay and we used the terrace only minimally, it was very nice in the late evenings to go out on it (particularly after exciting soccer wiins by Italia!!). Our room was cozy but quite frankly fit our family of 5 just fine. The airconditioning worked GREAT, the breakfasts were wonderful (each day's special pastry was my favorite) and the hosts were all very nice. In particular we enjoyed talking with the gentleman that worked evenings and was there to greet us upon our arrival day. Oh - and - as stated throughout Tripadvisor the location can not be beat. We would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, perfectly-located little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome for our first anniversary and wanted something special but not too pricey, though I should point out it's not that cheap but it is worth it. Residenza Canali fulfilled all our needs. It was perfectly located for all the sites, is just off a lovely street (Via Coronari), which is full of antique and quirky shops. Our room was really clean and so peaceful and quiet, and, most importantly when temperatures soared to 35+ outside, perfectly air-conditioned. The owners/staff were so friendly and helpful. I'd heartily recommend this little hotel to anyone. Enjoy Roma!

Reviews.Title: “love this area”
Reviews.Author: Robin509
Reviews.Content: we stayed 4 nights and loved this hotel. we droped our car at the Rome airport and took a taxi. It was a challenge for our taxi to find the place, we even asked several police and they had no idea. Finally, after locating the hotel on a quaint streel, Stephen, took our luggage up stairs. I had requested a room with a terrace for 3 persons. The climb (6 floors) was worth it. Great way to walk off all the calories consumed while traveling. The front desk was always helpful. Several times my daughter and I went shopping at 6 pm and instead of taking our bags to our room before dinner, we deposited them at the front desk to hold until we returned. I guess we were too lazy to walk the stairs. Great restaurants nearby, easy walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps. We loved walking and exploring the wonderful small streets nearby. Nice breakfast, typical of european hotels. We did take advantage of their car service on our return trip home. 45 euros and I tipped him an extra 5. We would stay there again. Air conditioned and it works, well worth it after a hot day exploring Rome. We also paid cash to obtain the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit not as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Tsalib
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residenza Canali again this year since we had such a positive experience there two years ago. Over all, I would have to say it was OK, but not outstanding. We were in room D. The shower was very small compared to the shower we had the first time we were there. You could hardly turn around in it. There was no bathtub. The mattress was very, and I do mean VERY hard. The people at the desk were very helpful and courteous. Breakfast was adequate. The location of the Residenza Canali is exceptional. Not a 4 star hotel, but it does not have 4 star prices either.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Roman Hide-away.”
Reviews.Author: Collingham Commuter
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a great weekend in Rome. The Residenza Canali was a perfect little place to stay - well-positioned, extremely friendly and helpful staff (esp. Stephan - thank you!), delicious breakfasts etc etc. Our room was delightful with a pretty roof terrace - perfect for a late-night glass of wine (a nice touch was the corkscrew and extra-large glasses for red wine!!) Its a very relaxing place to stay - a real oasis of calm in a very busy city. I would recommend the airport collection service - we used it both ways and it was well worth it! Many thanks to all at Residenza Canali - we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: janeqpublic
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, nice breakfast. The entrance door is locked and you have to ring to be admitted, which is nice for security. I was promised a double room for single use (and I had the email from the hotel staff with me) but I got stuck in a tiny single room. When I asked to be changed if a double was available they said I could change. I was there for one night and they rudely told me to return back to the single room and I mean very rudely. I won't go into all the aggravation they put me though, but it was not worth it and nearly ruined my trip. I also wonder about fire safety there, the main hallway/stairwell that is in the middle of the building could act like a flue in case of a fire and there are no fire escapes. I smelled smoke one night and figured out it was coming in from outside but it left me wondering about fire safety for the rest of the night. I would return but with my husband, a businesswoman traveling alone does not receive their respect. It is a shame.

Reviews.Title: “what's the fuss about”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cant understand what all the fuss is about, its an ok hotel with some pleasent staff. The rooms are average and the bath rooms small. Plenty of hotels in Rome that are better for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “A word of warning”
Reviews.Author: bigdunc
Reviews.Content: Whilst I agree with many of the comments with regard to this hotel, I would want to point out that the room I stayed in (room A), was one of the smallest and definitely the noisiest room I have ever stayed in. There was an adjoining door to the the room next to it and you could hear absolutely everything from in there - literally the sound of the guest reading the morning paper. Being the first room at the top of the stairs, the noise from people passing by in the corridor was also very disturbing - lie ins were definitely not possible. As we were out of the room for most of the time I wouldnt say that this overally affected our stay, however i did feel the extent of the problem was so severe that people should be made aware of the situation. I would agree that the location was absolutely superb. We also used the airport transfer service, and again would agree that if it wasnt for this, the place would have been incredibly hard to find - especially arriving late at night. The breakfasts though, were very basic, and often had little remaining when we turned up (not particularly late). Overall, not great value for money and definitely some issues but maybe the location compensates for most of these...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of Residenza Canali could not be better, our room was clean and the bed comfortable, but what really distinguishes the place is the kindness of the hosts. We stayed four nights, then went off to Naples for another four nights, intending to fly home from there. But our connecting flight home was canceled because of a labor walkout, and the only workable option offered us by the airline was a flight to Rome and a two-night layover there. When we reappeared at the Residenza Canali, totally unexpected, they went out of their way to accommodate us, putting us up for one night and allowing us to stay in an apartment across the street for the other. Of particular help was Stefano Benassi, one of the receptionists, who speaks excellent English (everyone there speaks some). He was extremely kind to us, looking up train and airline information and letting us send e-mail, and we very much enjoyed talking to him when we came back in the evenings. We felt that we'd made an incredibly lucky choice. So take the positive comments posted here seriously. For those who don't require luxury, this is a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this little gem. This tiny hotel is tucked away - but just barely. It is very close to the Piazza Navona, the location was perfect for us. We were within very easy walking distance of the Piazza Navona, Pantheon, and 10 min. walk from St. Peter's and the Coloseum. The staff was wonderful and friendly. It is located on the third floor and reached via very small - tiny - stair way. This would not be a good choice for people who cannot navigate stairs. Breakfast was a nice continental selection in a quiet, cozy, and pretty room. I will stay here the next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Messing people about!”
Reviews.Author: Fi123456789
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed with hotel's customer service! Booked hotel through Worldby for March and they accepted, sending confirmation email. They then sent another email cancelling our reservation, saying they had given room to someone else. This is a disgrace and they're customer relations need serious work, because now we must start from scratch, and given that we waited a week for this to go through their system, and many hotels are already fully booked, I am worried we'll end up in a worse hotel. Not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Rome in February”
Reviews.Author: lbrach
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, well worth using the airport pick up service as hard to find the first time, it doesn't even have a name outside. Don't stay here if steps bother you, no lift and even reception is up one floor. Nice helpful staff and a good breakfast. Great central location, you can walk almost anywhere in central Rome in 30 mins or less, from the Colloseum to the Vatican. One tip, keep away from the Spanish Steps area right now, all the roads around dug up and walking through hard, and the chuch at the top is hidden behind scaffolding and hoardings. Good restaurant a few steps from the hotel, also one I would recommend. One thing though I noticed all over Rome is the prevalence of graffiti, including by the hotel, something that didn't used to be there so much, worrying they don't seem to clean it off.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman treasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked an airport transfer thru the hotel and were collected by a very well-dressed driver in a Mercedes who spoke a little English and was delighted to point out some sights during the short journey into Rome..the Residenza is along a pretty cobbled street where some of the best antique shops in Rome can be found -the Via de Coronari -very quaint and on discovery -what a fantastic location! The hotel staff were very friendly and most welcoming, as we were staying over New Years Eve we found a basket of fruit with a Happy New Year card in our room (No 1)..the room was spacious, very clean and serviced daily. We had a lovely big terrace overlooking the pretty rooftops and church steeples -very picturesque and romantic!
