A lovely breakfast room lit with candles and a more than adequate self-service Continental breakfast. Stefano and all the staff were most helpful in recommending restaurants and places of interest. A fabulous location surrounded by pretty cobbled streets, minutes away from the Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps and the Vatican..and lots of little places with checked table cloths and great Italian food. When we return to Rome which is a must, we wouldnt stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Book It!”
Reviews.Author: tghiemstra
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the Residenza Canali and loved it! The reviews in "Trip Advisor" are on the money...great value for the money (pay cash and get a nice discount). You won't get all the frills of a large hotel (only 7 rooms) but if you're in Rome to experience "Roma" and not the ambience of a large hotel, this is your place! It's a little hard to find...exit Piazza Navona to the north, turn west(left) for two blocks. The entrance is only a door at the street level...buzz to be let in. The breakfast is wonderful, the staff is friendly and helpful, and you can walk to the Vatican and St. Peter's (30 min).

Reviews.Title: “Residenza Canali a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TNMarianne
Reviews.Content: The Residenza Canali was just a great hotel for us. The location was just perfect. We could walk to almost everything we wanted to see. It was very close to the Piazza Navona. One rainy afternoon we sat all afternoon at an outdoor cafe and just watched the activity at the Piazza. (Under umbrellas at the restaurant.) The breakfast they provided was delicious. The pastries were outstanding. There was fruit, meat, cheese, cereal and lots of wonderful teas. When we arrived at 9:30 a.m., even though we hadn't been there the night before, they invited us to get something to eat. That was much appreciated by two weary travellers from the U.S. Oh yes, they speak English. The room was small as most Rome hotel rooms are but it had a huge bathroom with all the amenities. When we did need a taxi or transportation to the ship for a cruise they arranged it for us. The folks at the hotel made us feel like family. You do have to know there are no elevators. This building is a historical landmark so they are not allowed to have elevators installed, but they are happy to help you with your luggage if you ask. Oh yes, the room we had was very quiet. We did hear a rooster and in the early evening a motorcycle, even a couple arguing in Italian but we loved it. We plan to return to the Residenza Canali.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: emilyrushing
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Residenza Canali for two nights. We waited until the last minute to book a room, but thankfully they had one remaining for us. While our room was on the smaller side (compared to other rooms in the hotel) we were just grateful to them for having something available! The room was just fine for our needs. The staff was very nice and the location is great - just a stone's throw from the Piazza Navona. We were able to walk to every destination within the City's Center with no problem. If you stay here, be sure to ask for dinner recommendations. Both places they sent us were wonderful! Both close to the hotel, but off the beaten path enough that we got a real dining experience instead of the generic pizzeria's that you see everywhere. I have no hesitation in recommending this place to anyone who wants great location and great service.

Reviews.Title: “awelcome retreat”
Reviews.Author: janeNewark
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at this wonderful hotel for four nights. It was just what we dreamed of! Wonderful breakfasts, lovely rooms and roof garden, very professional and helpful staff, fantastic location. WE will return!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: GRNZ
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay Location: You will find it hard to beat!! Close to everything you will want to see. Tip: Suggest you take advantage of the hotels pick up service as it is a litlle bit hard to find. Room: We had a second floor room. It was very comfortable. Spacious but not large. Well presented. Good amenities. No complaints at all!! The rooms are in keeping with the style of hotel - Family style hotel in Historical area of Rome. Hotel Amenities: No Lift but no problem if you are aware of this in advance Dining room is small but more than adequate. We never had a problem getting seated. The breakfasts are superb!!! Wonderful Bakery selection!!! A highlight in our day. Staff were very friendly and a good source of information for restaurants etc A charming hotel - very much enjoyed!!! Ask the staff for directions to the Oseria del Pegno restaurant and try the Tiramisu!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Monikaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the penthouse with the private balcony during our honeymoon in September. In my opinion, the hotel was not worth the 265 Euro per night. The view from the penthouse was nothing special - just satellite dishes on rooftops and one church spire. The amenities are few, the 5 flights of stairs were no fun with our luggage, and the front desk staff were not nearly as friendly or helpful as other hotels we stayed in throughout Italy. The shower had broken doors, so water flooded the bathroom. In addition, the TV didn't work. Minor annoyances, but for the money, I expected better. Walking around the area we found 2 four-star hotels for 125-165 Euro, and the famous Raphael hotel, which looked absolutely amazing, was the same price as our place - 265 Euro - but MUCH MUCH nicer. Don't mind spending the money, but I want it to be worth it. I felt we could have stayed in a place right around the corner (sorry - I forgot the name of the other hotels) for equal cleanliness, better amenities and much less money. I really would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and a good value”
Reviews.Author: 2travel039
Reviews.Content: This was not our first choice of a hotel in Rome, but were unable to book our regular hotel. We were pleasantly surprised with the Residenza Canali. Our room was acceptable in size and very clean. The showers are very small, but they worked. Our friends were able to book a room on the top floor with a terrace, and this would be the best choice. You should be aware that there is not an elevator. The staff is willing to carry all of your luggage, though. All of the staff can speak English and were very gracious and helpful. The breakfast was fine, but they did not serve steamed milk with their coffee. I found this to be disappointing since that is one of the things I enjoy about Italy. The location is perfect for walking all around Rome. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Canali is worth climbing the stairs for”
Reviews.Author: nedk
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 day stay in rome at the Residenza Canali. Although initially hard to find, as the sign is tiny which resulted in a trip down a rather dark alley, once there we were very pleased with our choice. The stairs will be a problem for anyone who is unfit but for us being on the top floor in room 1 with a terrace and a view over the roofs was worth the heavy breathing. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. The bathroom was fine although the shower door was a bit loose. Breakfast was simple but adequate. The staff were helpful and full of good ideas for eating in the evening. Best to ask rather than leave it to chance or a rather generic guide book. Location is handy for most places and several buses run past the end of the Via Coronari (87 82 492 70 and others all of which will take you to one or other of the sites: the signs at the stops give lists of where they go). We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: LuxetVeritas
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have stayed at or seen in Rome, the Residenza was the most perfect. It had a great location - it is just as easy (and picturesque) to walk to the Vatican from it as to walk to the Old and Ancient parts of Rome. Furthermore, the staff was courteous and helpful in the extreme, the beds excellent, the rooms cool and well-lit. Perhaps above all, however, I appreciated the breakfast, which offered a wide variety of everything from fresh rolls to great cold cuts to keesh to coffe, etc. Perfect way to start the day. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: neverenoughtravel73
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in this lovely little hotel. We had an amazingly difficult time finding it at night down a very dark alley but eventually did find a much better lit way. We stayed one night in a standard room which really was nothing special but the last two nights we stayed at the top of the hotel and had a beautiful large terrace to ourselves. Our room was also larger on the top floor. In our opinion it is definately worth the extra money to have the terrace as that is what we loved the most about the hotel. The location was another huge plus as you are right next to the Piazza Navona and within a 10 minute walk from the Vatican and almost everywhere else. We did not have to take public transit or taxi accept to the airport!! There are alot of great restaurants right near by. The staff was very friendly, helpful and english was widely spoken. We felt that the price was a bit high for what the hotel offerred but that it was probably in-line with other hotels in Rome. If you stay out of the heart of the city I am sure it is a bit cheaper both for food and lodging. Staying right in the center though did really add to our experience in Rome. The breakfasts were adequate but not the best that we had eaten in Italy. Our only complaint was the taxi driver that the hotel had arranged to pick us up.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Family of 4 in a Quad room. Room had no number or letter on it, but it was on the first floor and other rooms were A,B and C so I assume this was D. Location was excellent. Rate for 4 was 192 euros, cash rate. Breakfast was standard Italian fare, cereal.oj, cold cuts, pastries, tea and coffe. More than sufficient. There is no elevator but someone kindly took all our heavy luggage to our room. The room itself was quite pokey. Described as a 2 room suite, but really too small for 4 people,but as we were not in the room much that was ok. However for a longer than 1 night stay I could not have done it. Decor in room was tired and needed revamping and really the room did not smell clean. The master bedroom was really cramped. Bathroom was newer , good size , well appointed . Towels although plentiful were thin and threadbare. I would rate it a good 1 star or lower end 2 star. The location to the sights is really the attraction for this property. In terms of value for money it is certainly not what you would get in Canada for that price ,but as we all know Europe is expensive. I have to rate Banchii Vecchi the other property we stayed at higher in terms of accomodation and value for money ,but this propery is closer to the action. As long as you are aware that you are paying for really basic accomodation (albeit a quaint building) in a good location you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Local Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of eight stayed in two doubles and a suite for 3 nighys in July. Located on a small street just off the Piazza Navona, the hotel was lovely and the staff could not have been more accomodating. We arrived very early and although the rooms were not ready they stored our luggage and gave us access to a bathroom to cleanup. The rooms were clean and pretty and the bathrooms were recently rennovated. The air conditioning kept us cool on some very hot July nights and we did not hear the street noise at all. Breakfast was excellent with lots of variety. Check out the local resturant next door. Our hosts recommended it and we weren't disappointed. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique friendly hotel - must go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsAJC
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for a week and what a wonderful week it was!!! The hotel building is set in a quiet street and the rooms are gorgeous! Our room had plenty of space for the both of us, high celings, lovely furniture and had a lovely roof terrace and well presented bathroom. We stayed on the top floor and although after a full day of walking the stairs seemed a tiresome task, once you got into your room, you totally forgot about the hike up there!!! Our room was cleaned every day, with fresh towels, more soap and tea and coffee. The breakfast was very nice, with fresh croissants, cakes, bread and fruit. Also there was cereals, youghurts and fresh orange juice. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. They helped us with our cases to the top floor and offered to order us a taxi on our return journey. The hotel is set in such a central location, yet it is in a safe and quiet location. We found all that we wanted to see was in a short distance of the hotel. All in all it was a very memorable holiday and I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: charlieg
Reviews.Content: Very small, very clean, very friendly, very well located Only beef was the size of the bathroom and shower - we stayed in the suite (room 5) and it was just too small for 4 people. Later moved to room D when we were only 2 people in the party and that room would have been much better! - ask for it if you can - great bathroom Lack of elevator did not bother us but could be a problem negotiating the stairs with luggage for some Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Rome with children [15 and 11] and grandparents. We had a fabulous time and the care and attention shown by the staff at the hotel made the 5 days feel really special. The rooms were lovely and beautifully clean - we enjoyed the terrace very much. Breafast was looked forward to with great anticipation - what delights would we be tempted with!! A wonderful location - so central for all the sights and plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: princetontraveler
Reviews.Content: Traveling as two families - each with 2 adults and 2 teens - rented three rooms in June at this small very conveniently located hotel near the Piazza Navona. Kids got a quad and each couple a double room. Rooms were very nicely furnished and comfortable. Two rooms had lovely balconies overlooking the picturesque street below. Two quibbles - the showers were very small, necessitated by having been retrofitted into an existing bath; and the stairs, though manageble, were fun to navigate loaded with baggage - especially four levels to the top floor. The hotel keepers were wonderful, spoke English well and were cooperative, even with ouir silly questions and requests. All in all a very nice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Tomma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my Honeymoon in Rome. What a fabulous City! We stayed at the Residenza Canali. This was the perfect Hotel for us, we had a superb room with our own roof terrace. The location is excellent just off Piazza Navona and within walking distance of all main attractions. All staff were very friendly and we were served a delicious breakfast every morning. There are a lot of stairs to climb if you are staying in the room with a roof terrace but it was worth the climb. Got used to the stairs by the end of the week due to all the walking we were doing. Very clean Hotel and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Excellent Location!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaBella
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! I found the hotel on this website (Trip Advisor) and based upon the reviews decided to book a 2-night stay for my family. We are a family of 5, so we booked the Junior Suite and it was excellent. We had two rooms and a nice bath. The rooms were very clean, set up perfectly for us and ready when we arrived. We had the unfortunate luck of having no luggage when we arrived in Rome (lost in transit between Paris and Rome by the airlines), so we had to work with the desk clerks to be on alert for luggage deliveries from the airlines during our stay. They were fantastic to work with, very helpful and very attentive. Once our luggage arrived, they brought it up to our rooms and notified us immediately upon our return to the hotel from a day of siteseeing that the luggage had arrived. The breakfast was very good, fantastic coffee and lots of choices for the kids. The location is excellent. We were able to walk to Vatican City in ten minutes and to Piazza Navona in 2-3 minutes. There are a lot of cafes and gelato stops close by and some really neat little restaurants. I recommend enjoying a pizza or some pasta at one of the restaurants on the backside of Piazza Navona, as the prices are a bit lower than inside the Piazza itself. This is a great place to stay, especially for a family needing a bit more room than a standard hotel in Rome provides.

Reviews.Title: “Italy in November”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I organized a family trip to Italy for my husband, daughters, 11 and 9, and my parents, 60 and 61, and me. The trip began in Rome on 11 November then went to Cinque Terre and Venice where we left for home on 21 November. I used trip advisor extensively to get recommendations. I made all reservations by internet/email.I also enjoyed reading Rick Steves tour info out loud as we toured. He has our kind of sense of humor. We also had a book entitled, Italy with Kids, that was a big help. One of this book’s suggestions was to pack once then take out one third of what we packed. We decided to go even lighter as an experiment. I highly recommend packing very light. No one cares that you wore the same thing over and over, but getting around by plane and train was much easier. So was unpacking and repacking at each hotel. We also didn’t have room to carry souvenirs so we were very choosy. Four my family of four we had a carry on size bag for my girls, plus one backpack of light weight toys/books, and for us we had a medium suitcase plus one Rick Steves day pack (loved it). For an example of what we packed, I packed on jeans, one dress slacks, one dressy sweater, and two long sleeve shirts, and one pair of dressy flat shoes. I wore one jeans and shirt, well broken in black shoes (Landsend all weather leather mocs). All my shirts were similar color so I used one scarf to dress them up. I brought the dress pants and shoes for the Vatican, but found that jeans/casual shoes would have been fine. I never wore them again. We paid to have our laundry done at Hotel Pasquale in Cinque Terre. My parents packed one carry-on size bag and one Rick Steves daypack. They didn’t do any laundry on the way, but my mom hand washed a couple of things. I will never pack heavy again! We zipped on and off of trains and up and down hotel stairs, my smallest daughter didn’t have to carry or pull anything, and we could easily count and keep track of every piece. Grand total, 6 people, three small suitcases and three half-filled backpacks! Here are my recommendations: Rome. We stayed in Hotel Residenza Canali. It was small but very nice, warm in each room and the breakfasts were good. Nothing hot like eggs, but the variety and quantity was very good. There is no elevator and we were on several flights up. This is just a caution not a negative. The staff was very helpful, calling taxis, giving directions, advice. I really enjoyed the stay. It is located very close to Piazza Navona which is very centrally located. We had a family room for the four of us and my parents had a double. Our room was very spacious, but my parents was a little tighter. Both were well furnished and very clean. The restaurant they recommend right next door was very good and I recommend it. The weather was mostly cloudy and rainy one day. We had fall jackets and hats and scarves to be safe. Some days warmed up and we carried our jackets. Overall we were very fortunate with the weather. November weather is hit or miss, but the lack of crowds and draining heat make up for the chill or drizzle. I recommend November and it’s low season prices. We did mostly walking, averaging 8-10 miles per day according to my Mom’s pedometer. This doesn’t give extra credit for stairs, but made it fun to keep trekking. We walked to the Vatican, which takes 30 minutes at a leisurely pace. The taxi ride is 5-10 minutes. We enjoyed the Papal audience (arrive very early). We sat to the right of the alter which still had front row seats when the center seats will filled all the way back. The seats on the right aren’t visible from the door, so they are easily overlooked. We really hit the jackpot we thought. We had plenty of time to wander around and look at the statues while one of us held our seats. We returned the following day to tour the Vatican. Definitely go up to the top of St. Peter’s! In Rome we also enjoyed the Coliseum and Forum, Castelo Angelo, Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and the churches. We were always shocked at the beauty inside a church that didn’t look that great from the outside. We left by train to go to Cinque Terre. We bought tickets at the train station, not in advance. I recommend 1st class if you can afford it and are taking a long trip. The price difference is not big but the seating is better and there is a snack car. Cinque Terre was a wonderful place. Don’t miss it or even make a special tirp just to go there some time. The weather was warm, upper 60s which allowed for no jackets most of the time. The walking is strenuous but the trails are huge fun and beautiful views. The kids LOVED it. They played on the beach one morning in their bathing suits for almost two hours! We stayed at Hotel Pasquale in Monterosso, which was a short, and pretty walk from the train station. Turn left outside the train and walk up the hill and through the tunnel. The hotel is on the other side. We again had a family room and my parents had a double. Both rooms had a beautiful view of the beach. The breakfast was delicious with a good variety. There were hard boiled eggs but no hot eggs or hot meats. Still very good. The low season rate was a steal for what we got I thought. Service was wonderful. They had a pay as you use internet to check email or transfer money. Again, no elevator. The shopping is mostly closed in November but that leaves more time for walking the trails between the five villages. We also used the train in between the villages. Don’t let the trail descriptions keep you away from walking. The walks are lots fo up hill and and little stairs, but take it at your pace and enjoy. In the off-season the trails are not crowded so you can take your time. I can’t recommend Cinque Terre in the off-season more highly. It was paradise. We left by train for Venice. Venice was much colder and we ended up buying hats and gloves for those without. We were lucky to not suffer through any floods. We stayed at the Hotel Mercurio using their November internet offer. We had to get a separate room for the girls, but they loved it. At the low season rate, the extra room was not more than we had paid for family rooms at the other hotels. The rooms were very simple very clean and comfortable. No elevator again. Breakfast was varied and delicious, but no hot dishes. The hotel was very centrally located. Next door was dinner restaurant that had the best liver and onions I will ever have. Liver and onions is a Venice specialty. The service was snobby but the liver and onions were worth it. It’s hard to resist shopping in Venice! Fortunately the shops close at 7PM or earlier in the off-season. The bad part is that you’ll spend more sight-seeing time to shop since you can’t shop in the evening. We enjoyed the bell tower, St Mark’s Square and Cathedral. The rest of the time we wandered the alleys to find sights we found in tour books. We took the tour arranged by our hotel to the glass factory in Murano. The water taxi was a blast, a highlight especially since it was free. We did end up buying something at the factory show room but it was not a really hard sell. If you are not in spirit to buy expensive glass then either skip Murano or go out on your own, not on an arranged tour. However, my favorite part was Burano Island to see lace making. Don’t miss the museum. Also, buy a piece of history that will soon be extinct, lace, if you can afford it. Be sure it is hand made lace. We like the shop called “Olga” which was near the museum. Yes, lace is very expensive, but it is art & crafts at is absolute finest and will soon disappear all together. Burano was lovely with it’s canal and colorful houses. We have lots of beautiful pictures. We took the waterbus back. We used the waterbus to go to the airport, but we should have taken the water taxi. For a large group like ours the cost was not much more and it would have been much faster and less noisy. Italy was great for kids. Plenty to see and do. Lots of things to climb on. The kids were missing school and each had to write a report when they returned. They carried a notebook and kept a journal each day. It was a good way to pass time at a restaurant or on the train. I also bought credit card size games for everyone. We had Yahtzee, Boogle, Connect Four, Battleship, Uno, and Hangman. Everyone enjoyed these and they were always handy on our pockets. Also, before your take your kids to Venice have them read “The Thief Lord” by Cornelia Funke, which is set in Venice. For adults, before you go to Rome and the Vatican read “The Pope and His Ceiling” by Ross King about Michelangelo and the Sistine Chapel. It opens up a whole new perspective. I just read Ross King’s “Brunelleschi’s Dome” about the great Santa Maria del Fiore’s dome in Florence. A must read before you go to Florence.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: niftydesign
Reviews.Content: For a first trip to Rome, this was the place to be. As others have already said, the major sights are all around a ten to fifteen minute walk from the hotel. Not to mention some of the most delicious gelato stands in town! The hotel itself is more like a pensione. The rooms are small and clean, and the bathroom spotless. The staff is very helpful. As another reviewer mentioned, you can hear the people in other rooms, and we had one relatively sleepless night. But overall, a good value, great location, and satisfying breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I looked at trip advisor before I booked Residenza Canali and it is most helpful when travellers post their comments, it has inspired me to make a comment to help other travellers! We have recently come back from Rome, and I have to say we had a fabulous time. The hotel in my mind was perfect, situated in the old town, surrounded by cobbled streets and antique shops. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was served 7.30-10.00 and there was a good selection too. We stayed on the first floor, which you reached via a winding staircase - for some reason they still had a christmas tree by the stairs!! which we found amusing. The rooms were of good size, clean with a daily maid service. You could not fault the location of this hotel, it was excellent. All the main attractions are easily within walking distance, to give you an idea, the Piazza Navona is literally minutes, if you continue through the Piazza Navona and turn left you will shortly reach the Pantheon, to the right of the Pantheon there is a delicatessen (in a very pretty yellow building) try the twisted pizzas they are superb and cheap!!! The Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps were about 10 mins away from the hotel, similarly St Peters and the Vatican were also 10 mins. The coliseum was the furthest away at approx 25 mins. Rome is quite pricey even heading off down a side street away from the main attractions to find a little cafe or bar, prices still seemed to be dear, but this should not stop you from having a great time. The Via del Corso is heaven for anyone that loves shopping!! Italy apparently have 2 sales a year February they sell off the winter stocks and September they sell off the summer stocks - and boy there are designers bargains to be had!!! We had a great time and I would definitely return to the Residenza Canali, I do not think you could get a more reasonably priced hotel so centrally located to everything! (We paid a total of 304 euros for 3 nights).

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: anderjim
Reviews.Content: At the risk of repeating what others have already said, we found Rezidenza Canali the answer to our dreams -- pleasant, English-speaking staff; ideal location on a back street of a busy part of town; clean; and full of Roman character. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff but extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: sandih
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I had a triple and my parent had a double for 3 nights around New Years of 2004. The central marble staircase is incredibly noisy as there are no doors in the stairwell for blocking the sound as people tromp up and down stairs at all hours. Also, the walls are paper thin so you get intimately familiar with the bathroom habits of those next to you. I could also hear water running through the pipes in the ceiling. The breakfast was very good. The receive fresh baked bread and pastries every morning from a nearby bakery. One morning, the hearty bread was still so hot from the oven that it melted the butter I put on it. They were able to give us a few good restaurant recommendations and arranged a large car for 5 of us plus luggage to pick us up at 4:30am to go to the airport on New Years Day. The rooms were minimal, failry clean and the bathrooms were good except that we had ants in our bathroom one morning. The didn't reappear the next morning though. The hotel itself was ok, not great but the location is super. I think it's a little over-priced for what you get but you're probably paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travellevret
Reviews.Content: Pros--charming, good location, very clean, great staff, memorable breakfasts Potential issues for some people--small, must take stairs I just spent a week at this is a delightful little inn in the heart of Rome. I had a few special requests in advance of the stay and while in Rome and the staff handled everything quickly and cheerfully. The breakfasts were memorable (I loved the elegant presentation and attention to detail given to the place settings), but the best part about the place are the very nice and helpful staff. My room was simply but nicely decorated and small, but not cramped. There was a bit of noise from the lively Via de Coronari in the evenings, but the sound-resistant windows blocked most noise quite effectively. Noise should be a problem only for the most sensitive of people; if that is likely to be a concern, request a room in the back. The usual toiletries and hair dryer were provided. I required an outlet adaptor for my American plugs. The location near Piazza Navona is also wonderful (especially during the Christmas season when there is a market). Via de Coronari is a great alley for strolling and window-shopping and very active in the early evenings. The hotel is very near the Vatican and Pantheon. I like the this area much better than the area immediately around the Vatican, which feels more touristy and is really dead in the evenings. Most things are within a walkable distance, but I recommend asking the staff about buses. The nearby 81 and 87 are very easy to take and handy to the forum area and Southeast. I found that it worked well to ride out in the morning and work our way back to the hotel on foot. The Residenza is small and does not provide the extra facilities of large hotels such as a currency exchange (but it makes more sense to use ATMs), business center, fitness center, restaurant, etc. If you need something in particular, ask in advance. The only thing I might have liked would have been an internet station. If you prefer large lobbies, anonymity and the predictability of large hotels (or require some of those facilities), this is not the place for you. If do you stay here, I recommend using hotel-arranged transportation from the hotel. The price seems about the same as a taxi and they will be able to find the hotel. Make sure to have cash ready to pay the driver (I wish the hotel would pay them and add the charge to the bill). Bottom line: this is a great choice if you want 5-star quality for less money and prefer a small place over a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Kiss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Residenza Canali is the most beautiful hotel in the world

HotelInfo.Name: Residenza Canali ai Coronari
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Tre Archi 13, 00186 Rome, Italy
